review: After taking this for two months for my social Anxiety disorder,  I realised that it doesn't work for me

Turned me into a shell of my former self. Lost all motivation, actually gained more social anxiety, the dreams you get are also just too much; not to mention the absolute brain fog you have everyday. I also continued to have worsening panic attacks. Maybe the drug wasn’t for me, and I should’ve been treated with more of something that helps with my panic disorder, but the effects it had on my brain and body the 6 months I took it (and the incessant nature of my doctor telling me to continue taking it because it’ll eventually work) caused me to switch doctors and taper off of it on my own. I’ve been off of it for about 2 months now, and I can still feel lasting effects, but this drug truly did nothing but harm my lifestyle and everything about me as a person. Like I said at the start, while I was on this drug I was literally a Shell of My Former Self.

After the death of a family member I suddenly started to suffered serious panic attacks where It felt like my arms were being dipped in hot water with tingles of hands and feet. Sometimes all night. I also suffered anxiety with constant overthinking, total loss of appetite.I started on 10mg.  The first two weeks it made my anxiety and panic worse, I almost stopped taking it as could not bear it.  I pushed through and WOW am I glad I did.  Like magic on day 13/14 I had my appetite back and the anxiety lifted.After 6 months of 10mg per day I feel amazing. no anxiety and enjoying life again.Please stick it out for at least 14 days. it is worth it.

I have been on Lexapro previously, I have restarted 2 weeks ago. I suffer from GAD, intrusive thoughts and panic attacks. I can’t tell you how much this medication has helped me. The first few days, my anxiety was worse. I do recommend using something like Clonazepam. Before I restarted, my anxiety got so bad, from the moment I work up, my heart was racing. I felt like I had butterflies in my stomach. I was just getting to the point that working was becoming challenging. I would look forward to the end of the day so I could just sleep and have a break. I was terrified I would never feel better. Thinking I couldn’t go on this way anymore. I would think about things I would have to do in the coming months and I was terrified, everything felt so difficult. After 5 days on he medication, I started getting these moments of clarity. I’m now completely back to normal- I feel joy! Hang in there, you will get relief. Praying for you all.

Being honest my mental health has been in decline a long time, basically throughout pandemic and a lifetime of being able to try and live with crippling anxiety. I got back to UK from being in foreign Country. My anxiety it was work related and led to a major increase in anxiety, self harm, loss of job and sent home. On return I was prescribed Vencarm XL 225mg which was not in any was effective for me. My anxiety went through roof. I started Escitalopram last week at 5mg. I was drinking alcohol, bad idea, and begging for Xanax to curb anxiety, to no avail. I had no alcohol today, second day. Doctor had prescribed 28 Escitalopram 10mg which I had to face the outside world to go and fetch. I will not over dramatise my anxiety at thought of leaving my room as you will know. However, I faced it and was shaking, but on interaction with someone else the crazy feelings went a little and went more as I got to fresh air. In short, Escitalopram appears to working for me; however, it is still early days.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro has been extremely helpful and changed my life. I experience anxiety and some depression and was scared to go on meds after lots of therapy. I can say that my 10mg dose has truly changed my life and brought my life back to normal. I have did experience some weight gain however my life over the past 1.5 years being so much better is worth it. Overall, I recommend Lexapro! It gave me my sparkle back and I hope can for you! ( female, 19 years old )

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been taking Lexapro for about 8 months and I have had side effects. I have experienced tremors, vaginal numbness and excessive sweating as well as moderate heart palpitations.

I took Cipralex for 6 years, and it worked fine with me, then I decided to taper off as I convinced myself that I don't need it.I tapered off it for 2 months and quit completely, under some stressful conditions - anxiety, and panic attacks hit me hard.  I was rushed to ER several times, then my doctor put me on it again 10 mg, per day.First 11 days were a nightmare with increased anxiety, insomnia, fast heart rate, slightly high pressure, foggy head, pounding head and  ears, but at day 14, I started to feel the difference again. I could control my anxiety, if you have started it, stay with it, be patient. it will work.Us people with serotonin deficiency leads to release of cortisol and adrenaline with leads anxiety and attacks and depression,Stick with it, be strong...as they say, no pain no gain.When you have a headache you take a pain killer, we have serotonin deficiency so we take lexapro or cipralex just to regulate this chemical in our brain...we are not mentally or emotionally down...

I have been taking escitalopram for three months now it has saved my life! My anxiety before was just getting progressively worse to the point I was experiencing physical symptoms that I would wind myself up into thinking I had something else wrong with me! I was not sleeping, I didn’t want to be on my own but then when I had company I wanted to be on my own, my relationships were suffering as I was just constantly in flight or fight mode. I was never depressed just anxious over trivial things or things that hadn’t even happened yet! The first week of taking 10mg were a little rough.. my anxiety was heightened, I had a funny tummy and felt a bit nauseous and lost my appetite but after that each week just got better and better. My head is finally clear and my relationships with my family and partner are healthier. I can finally make plans and not over think it, life is much more enjoyable and I can’t believe I was against taking meds for so long.

This pill saved me! I was really avoiding on starting antidepressants due to being scared of the side effects....I've never had anxiety in my life I was always such an out going happy person, then it's like it came out of no where, I struggled with it for almost a year. One day I thought I would be good to go shopping alone and bam! Instant panic and started getting dizzy and tingly on my arms I was scared! I breathed though it and punched my arms to feel pain other then that tingly feeling, bought my items and went straight home to cry in a ball.  I called my doctor to start on the antidepressants I couldn't take it anymore! I was getting depressed as well I just wanted to feel normal again ....The first week of taking my medication I had a sore stomach and headache, those were the only side effects I had. (Everyone is different) It has been almost 3 months since taking these I am happy once again with no anxiety but 30lbs over weight. I am still gratefully thank you!

I have been on escitalopram for a couple years. I have on many occasions in my life just literally exploded in my life during tense situations. After a couple of months on this drug, when a situation would arise I found that during a situation where I would usually fly off the handle there is a split second before this happens that I hesitate, and analyse what is going on. It has been absolutely great for my personal life and my career. After a couple months more on the drug I realised I had lost all desire to consume alcohol, what a fantastic drug, I will take it with deep gratitude for the rest of my life.

Lexapro (escitalopram):On day 12 of Lexapro. 5mg. Still having anxiety but keep listening to Therapist and Dr that keep on the Med. It will get better. Gets so frustrating but I am hanging in there. First time on antidepressant and glad I found this place to get answers.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I don’t know who needs to hear this but this drug saved my life. I have suffered with anxiety since childhood but never knew what it was till my twenties. By the time I was 27 I was virtually an agoraphobic that was afraid to go anywhere and had panic attacks atthe grocery store and at my job, it was debilitating. When my ex and I split and I moved into my apartment I was a mess, I could literally not eat or sleep and never left my house. It got so bad that I told my mother I thought I would either commit myself into a hospital or kill myself. She talked me into seeing my doc. He prescribed me 5mg of lexapro and I had my mom stay the night in case I had a bad reaction. Within a week I felt much better and my only side effect was that I was sleepy in the morning. Within the year of this drug I have become a completely different person. I have no anxiety and I don’t worry about anything. I run every morning, I got a new job and a new relationship! I finally feel normal and starting to live life!

Lexapro (escitalopram):For nearly a decade I was terrified to try any kind of psychiatric medication. I was afraid it would change my personality, turn me into a zombie, make me go crazy, you name it. 3 years ago I finally tried Lexapro for my OCD and anxiety and it has changed my life so drastically. I should start by saying I also went to therapy and that helped tremendously, but I went from being someone who was afraid to drink tap water, had terrible agoraphobia, and weekly panic attacks, to being almost entirely anxiety free. The only side effects I've experienced are slight decrease in sex drive and slight flattening if highs and lows in my mood. I slowly went from 2.5 mg to 5 to 7.5 and now I take 10mg daily

Started taking escitalopram just over 2 weeks ago now and now that the initial side effects are wearing off, I'm feeling significantly calmer and happier. I am already so much more easygoing and feel like I am coming back into myself more every day, so I am excited to see where I will be at in a few more weeks. The first 10 days was pretty rubbish, I felt completely exhausted and had issues with my sleep but like I say I'm slowly coming back to life and am really glad I stuck with the 10mg my GP prescribed me. Take it from someone who was really hesitant to take the medication - just try it because it could end up working for you and if you are reading this review now like I was a few weeks ago you probably have exhausted all other methods for getting some relief from anxiety anyway. Give it a go, you may feel crap already so why not try and see.

Lexapro (escitalopram):For anyone scared to take this medication do it. I was very against taking this medication because of all the bad reviews. I tried all kinds of natural remedies to help with my anxiety and depression and nothing was helping. I felt so hopeless and would cry praying every day to feel better and nothing was cutting it. I went to several different doctors hoping I was wrong and I didn’t need the medication till I spoke to a new doctor who treated me like a friend and not a patient. I was so lost didn’t want to work and when I did go I wanted to leave and not be around anyone. Some days were better then others, when I had that anxious feeling that would not go away and I just felt as if something bad was going to happen. I said I needed to do something about it. I cried and decided to take the lexapro. The first few days were a bit hard I felt jittery nervous but kept on going. About a week into taking the pill I started to notice the difference. I feel myself again❤️

Lexapro (escitalopram):Previously I had good results with Lexapro & stopped taking it after 10 months. Had a health scare & my anxiety got really bad. Started on 10 & after learning I needed surgery went up to 20. I also take Klonopin. After surgery I went back to 10mg. Last few weeks family drama triggered panic & anxiety. Went back up to 20. I reduced my Klonopin to .25 at night since .5 with 20mg of Lexapro made me tired in the morning. Feeling so much better. Can talk myself out of anxious thoughts, not on the verge of tears anymore, I have energy to do things. I have had crippling anxiety for decades. It’s stolen so much from me. This medication has made a big difference. I know anxiety can make you feel hopeless & helpless but don’t give up!!! It’s so nice to look forward to the start of a new day when the alarm goes off instead of dreading what my mind might put me thru. When 1st starting Lexapro it made my anxiety worse but that passes. I switched to name brand & works better for me.

I experience decrease level of critical thinking skills, decrease  level of learning new skills, very low sex drive, I had  very poor decision making skills, increase dryness, sleep issues, depression, more anxiety. I couldn't handle life very well. After I stop taking the medication my life slowly went back to normal. I CHANGED my diet and only taking mineral and vitamins. I totally suffered horribly on this drug. I wasn't able to complete task on this drug. I had performance issues at work and with people. ALSO believe it caused harm to my youngest child he was born with all type of issues. Change your diet, exercise, drink plenty of water, take mineral and vitamins..This medication made me mean and distasteful.
The only issue I have with this is it's really diminished my sex drive. I mean, I still can it, just don't want to. Anyone else having this issue?

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been taking lexapro for the past 7 months and it really helps, at first my anxiety and dark moods went worse and the drug took about 8 weeks to work. Now I am able to function and although I can still get frightened, its manageable.  I take 20mg and have no intentions of coming off it. The side effects are less severe than other drugs and I feel relaxed . Good luck and don't give up.

This drug is heaven. I was diagnosed with severe depression, but it all started with severe anxiety. But my doctor first put me on high dose of amitriptyline, when the severe depression reduced, severe anxiety struck in. Then my doctor put me on escitaloprám 10mg.  The first 6 weeks was terrible. I am on week 7. All I can say is my doctor is an angel and the drug has started working well, my anxiety has reduced and am feeling more like a normal human being. I can function better. It does not work immediately, you have to give it time. Am gradually feeling better. Add a good diet, exercise and you will be fine.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was so scared to try any medication for my anxiety, but I am so grateful that I did. I have had bad anxiety since as long as I remember, being 24 in the midst of the pandemic, I decided to take a leap. I took 2.5 then increased to 5, then after a couple months increased to 10 mg and have been taking it for 8 months.  First taking it, my side effects were just tiredness, not any nausea which is what I was afraid of - but more just not "feeling" hungry, but I would just remind myself to eat. At first it felt like it made no change because it was gradual, but I realized over the months that I have been in the best mental state I have EVER been in. My panic attacks, diarrhea everyday, constant dissociation, constant shallow breathing, has lessened so much. Less crying and mental breakdowns every other week. It is such a relief. Now, I still have anxiety - it doesn't go away, but it doesnt feel like it has full control over my life.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Okay so this is my third and final update on lexapro.  After trying it for over two months, it just wasn’t for me. I’ve never been suicidal, but it was causing suicidal ideations, it improved my anxiety, but made my depression so much worse. I just tapered off the lexapro and now giving Zoloft a try. My doc also added lamotrigine for the depression. This is just my experience, so please please don’t let others experience with a medication keep you from taking it. While lexapro didn’t work for me, it might be a miracle for someone else. Everyone’s chemistry and response is different. Please be patient and kind to yourself and give the medication a chance. The good news, if this one doesn’t work for you, there is one out there that will!!!

Hi!  I have been on Escitalopram 5 mg for 1.5 years.My basic anxiety and depression needed some treatment and at the same time I had fought with psoriatic arthritis which is a degenerative disease. I was given Methotrexate but I did not want that dangerous drug. Having learned how escitalopram works well as an anti-inflammatory I gave it a chance. Wow!  I could go normally again, I could dance- right after 3 weeks use! My anxiety is reduced, too and I am well balanced.  I suppose it is a very good medicine. I do not have any side effect! I may increase the dose if it is  necessary but it is a good feeling to stay on such a low dosage.

I have been taking Lexapro - Escitalopram for about 20 years with good results.  One of the  good effects is sound sleeping, which in turn gives me good results the next day coping with task and social interaction.  This has worked very good for me over the years, but our health plan changed and I am now getting meds from the U.S. Air Force pharmacy.  There seems to be a difference, and wondering if anyone else has experienced a change since taking their generic pills.  Albertsons / SAVON pills were white  round pills, whereas the Air Force has oval shaped salmon or pink pills marked SG on one side, and 153 on the other side.  I sleep well, but now have a lower frustration level and somewhat of an anger feeling sometimes.  Reaching out to see if the Air Force generic is not a LEXAPRO kind of pill.  Something is not right.  Comments ?

It works so well with my high anxiety and depression even on low does .I love this drug no need to live with high anxiety and depression since we have the science.I'm on 5 mg now and will increase to 10 mg for 1 month then reduce to 5 mg .

Lexapro (escitalopram):Started on Sertraline and moved onto this, too quickly probably, having not given the former a proper chance. Six months in and I feel the benefit and real relief from a lifelong condition. The one piece of advice is to give these meds a chance, results simply don't come overnight. It's only when several weeks, or months, have elapsed do you realise that an improvement has taken place. I would counsel against anything other than small amounts of alcohol, particularly in the first few weeks. It's not particularly down to interactions (it wasn't in my case anyway) it's just that alcohol just wipes out the gains that you get from these medications,In terms of side effects, yes there are some, but they do seem to pass (4-6 weeks) and for me at least, it's a trade off between those and the continued impact of anxiety. One needs to make up one's own mind on this. 10mg for me at the moment.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I just started lexapro last night. My doctor wants me to take it with my Prozac for a week until I get my body used to taking the lexapro. Let me just say in just one day this has been the most horrible experience ever. I had sharp stomach pains and really bad nauseous at night. I couldn’t sleep very good even though I was so tired, my heart was racing when I got up, and then when I went to class my anxiousness got worse than it’s ever been and I got a hot flash. I'm gonna not take the meds tonight to see how I feel tomorrow. If I feel better these meds aren’t worth it!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Y’all, I haven’t had a panic attack in 2 MONTHS. I used to get them every single day sometimes twice a day and it got to a point where I didn’t even wanna live anymore. As soon as I started lexapro I knew I was doing something right because after just two weeks on 5mg I was feeling better and going out of my comfort zone. It’s now been a month and a half on 10mg and I feel so great! I still have anxiety, worries and struggles. But I am able to calm myself down and release it. The first two weeks of it is rough (dizziness, tiredness, increased anxiety) but if you stick it out you won’t be sorry. I really hope this will help someone out there.

Lexapro (escitalopram):So I left a review a couple of weeks ago, around the four week mark and thought I would provide and update now at the 7 week mark. My lexapro (generic) was increased to 15mg two weeks ago and I actually feel like it has made my depression slightly worse with minimal improvement on the anxiety. My doctor just prescribed rexulti as an add on to the lexapro as it can help with resistant depression. I am also going to ask if I can go back down to the 10mg lexapro as I feel that helped a little more than the 15mg. Since starting the 15mg I’ve noticed more intrusive thoughts and a feeling that I quite can’t shake. Now with all this being said, this is just my experience. For some it works wonders, for others not so much. Be patient with yourself because it is all trial and error. And don’t get discouraged.

Lexapro (escitalopram):On the this for depression and anxiety. I started having suicidal thoughts and so hopelessly sad. I started therapy but didn't notice much difference. I was against taking meds but  eventually I gave up and asked the doc to prescribe ssri's for me and she had me started on 5 mg a day escitalopram generic.The first week I felt good  with some weird dreams and a bit of euphoria and some nausea. Week 2 I started having nightmares that was very vivid and horrible and anxiety got worse. Week 3 was also not fun  but very similar to week 2. I was a bit more sad. Week 4 I started feeling a bit better. Week 5  the doc upped the dose to 10 mg. I felt good for 4 days then my body started adjusting to new dose and it took 2 weeks of lower mood again. Nausea came back first 4 days of 10 mgs  in week 6 I started to feel much better. Now at week 8 no anxiety and no depression - I feel great. I've been exercising, cutting caffeine, eating healthy, no weight gain, no sex problems life is beautiful again. Give it time

Lexapro (escitalopram):Went on Lexapro for anxiety.It really helped.But the side effects of skin numbness, erectile dysfunction, emotional numbness, weight gain got bad enough that death seemed like a viable alternative.3 months off of it now and side effects have stopped. Still a lot of weight to lose and I'm back to the height of anxiety town.No idea what to do next.This drug stole 3 years of my life.

Lexapro (escitalopram):29 year old female, experiencing post pandemic anxiety. Prescribed 10mg lexapro for social anxiety and a fear of panicking in social situations. My anxiety became all consuming - I'd tried CBT, have been in psychotherapy for a long time, meditation etc. Medication was my last resort and I was really hesitant to start this as I didn't know if my anxiety was 'that bad' or if I could handle my own internalised stigma about being 'someone on meds'. Well, that's me now, and as soon as I started it I haven't looked back. SO glad I tried them, it took about 8 weeks for me to feel anything different, but once I did it just helped me to feel myself, balanced, not stressing about small things. I have my social life back. I had no side effects (apart from it taking slightly longer to orgasm) but even this has pretty much gone. I  feel like it was such a good decision to start lexapro, and I don't fear tapering off when the time is right as it was very easy going on them! Good luck :)

Lexapro (escitalopram):Patience is a virtue. I started lexapro 10mg after experiencing severe anxiety and panic attacks with mild depression after a recent move. I’ve never had anxiety, panic attacks, or depression until now. It was so bad, I sought help in a mental health hospital where I was started on lexapro and buspar. I want all to know that it might get worse before it gets better. Week three I had myself convinced it wasn’t working and I needed something else. By week four it was starting to even out. I’m nearing the end of my fourth week and while I’m not 100% back to my usual self, the improvement is obvious. I’m excited to see where this medication takes me in the next few weeks as I know it takes at least 4-6 weeks to really reach its full potential, sometimes even longer. I’ve learned to be patient with myself, be kind to myself, and in conjunction with therapy I think this medication really helps!! My biggest side effect has been loss of appetite which is returning and GI upset.

Before lexapro, I was a MESS. But now that I'm on lexapro, I'm not constantly worrying about every single thing. The only thing is, is that I'm gaining weight, and I know its from the drugs...But I WISH the weight gain wasn't a side effect otherwise I'd be taking this drug for life. I'm on 15mg. I could go up to 20mg but I'm choosing not to.

I had anxiety and depression. Doctor started it with 20mg and taken for 1 year. Then reduced to 10 mg for another 1 year. Now I am on 5 mg like a month. This is game changing medicine at starting levels and works well with little side effects at starting and then they go away. One should be positive in mind while taking this medicine and go out for walk in park or public places.
For me lexapro didn't help my social anxiety at all and yeah, used for 1 month.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’ve been on lexapro for 6 weeks and it has helped me so much. I have suffered with anxiety and depression since I was 9 years old - I just turned 24 two weeks ago. Through college, I struggled so much with my anxiety and depressed. ; Multiple suicide attempts) After watching family members and friends take anti depressants over the years, I was afraid to start medication.When COVID started in 2020, I started having chronic nightmares of being chased or murdered. I finally decided to seek help from my doctor. Lexapro has completely calmed my anxiety during the day time and nightmares. I no longer feeldepressive or suicidal thoughts. The negative side effects I’ve experienced so far are loss of libido. However, after a porn addiction for a decade, the loss of libido isn’t bad. I no longer rely on porn to orgasm and focus on my boyfriend instead.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I took a half a pill (5 mg), and it made me violently ill. I was warned that it might make me nauseous, but I dealt with intense vomiting, diarrhea, and nausea for 6-7 hours after taking just 1/2 a pill. I have heard that it gets better over time, but I was almost hospitalized due to severe dehydration, I'm not willing to go through that again. If you are sensitive to medication, or are prone to GI issues like I am, please look elsewhere.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was on Lexapro for three weeks. It did not work well for me. I had been suffering from anxiety and depression. It may have slightly helped my anxiety, but it far worsened my depression. I was having suicidal thoughts constantly that felt uncontrollable. I started at 10 mg and about 5 hours after taking the pill I felt like my body and head were on fire and I was extremely nauseous. This lasted for a few days but I cut the pills in half to 5 mg. Lexapro didn’t do anything for me. It made me feel like a zombie and I couldn’t cry when I wanted to or feel normal emotion. I realized it takes up to a month for full effect, but my doctor told me I should have had some relief by three weeks and I did not. Careful weaning off of it. I have bad headaches and dizziness now. Hopefully they'll go away soon.

I have suffered bouts of depression for most of my life, but following a traumatic family event and stressful house move I became overcome by extreme generalised anxiety. I had constant obsessional and morbid thoughts, and was waking up feeling terrible dread every morning. I had taken escitalopram previously a number of years ago for depression and remembered it had been a positive experience.I have been taking 5mg daily for around 3 months now and feel huge benefits. I would say however that my sleep is shallower and I dream more but I have stopped waking up feeling panic, sadness or a sense of dread. I now feel far calmer and obsessional, anxious thoughts melt away if they do arise. Side effects have not been significant for me fortunately. Having tried a number of other medications I would say escitalopram has been one of the most benign. It took around 5-6 weeks for my anxiety to fully improve so I would urge others to persevere to really see the benefits.

Lexapro (escitalopram):(Male/24) Initially lexapro made my anxiety worse, quite significantly. I experienced both anxiety & panic attacks at a greater frequency compared to prior to starting. Despite this, I have continued to take the medication with the hope that this side effect would lessen, despite most of my thoughts begging me to stop this medication. After about 12 days, I felt my body adjusting to the dosage. The last two days I have felt really great, no anxiety or racing heart rate (another initial side effect), no panic attacks and improved mood and enjoyment in things. I wanted to share just in case others are experiencing initial worsening anxiety and are unsure if this improves over time. Although my one experience is anecdotal, I am glad I stuck with it. I experienced headaches, nausea, jitteriness and trouble sleeping the first week as well, those too have gone away. My appetite has improved, and have had no complication with sexual dysfunction. I hope this helps

Lexapro (escitalopram):I took lexapro for depression and anxiety. Doc put me on lecapro and advised me to use 5 - 10 - 15 mg after few weeks.After taking this drug my anxiety skyrocketed. I wanted to die, I could sleep and felt awful.I woke up every day and go for a run just to get rid of my anxiety. I herniated my discs during severe workouts only to get rid of those horrible anxiety after waking up. My gf left me and I lost my health.I was depressed and anxious before but lexapro after one month destroyed me so much that I am not the same person anymore. Even 3mg did not help during these horrible lexapro times.Stay away from LEXAPRO it can ruin your life and destroy you.I used zoloft and xanax before but without any side effects. Lexapro is the worst thing that happened to me and I regret taking it every day and regret trusting my doc for putting me on it.

I've been on this 11 days and I feel horrible with increased anxiety and trouble sleeping. The bad stomach went away so basically no physical symptoms now but the increased anxiety and sadness is worse I'm not sure if I should push through because some say it takes weeks to feel better needing some advice/ encouragement

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was prescribed 10mg for anxiety and depression. the first 2 weeks gave me terrible side effects of nausea, suicidal thoughts, constant anxiety and loss of appetite which made it really difficult to eat anything at all and caused me to lose a bunch of weight. I stayed on it for 4 more weeks and the side effects at this point were only mild but my anxiety and depression stayed the same so at the 6 week mark my gp recommended withdrawing from lexapro and trying a different antidepressant. Even though I wasn’t on the med for very long, the withdrawals are bad with headaches, nausea, disassociation, anxiety and some of the strongest suicidal thoughts i’ve ever experienced. This isn’t to discourage anyone from taking it because I've heard many positive experiences, but be prepared for the side effects and stay safe!

I started having my first panic attacks and agoraphobia issues when I was 18, over 20 years ago. I went to hundreds, if not thousands, of hours of verbal therapies, I had tried everything apart from antidepressants, as I was simply too scared to take them. 3 months ago I found the courage to try escitalopram, after agreeing with my GP that we will be in close contact if I feel anything weird and that I will take xanax if I freak out. We agreed to start progressively, first 2.5 mg, then 5 mg etc. In the first 2 weeks I felt slightly weird, but nothing spectacular. Also, I started feeling from the first days a small resistance against developing a panic attack in typical situations. Today, I can say that the past 3 months with this medicine have been the most impressive improvement that I ever felt in my battle against anxiety. I feel almost like a 'normal person'! I even enjoy the only side effect that I have noticed, i.e. delayed ejaculation, as it actually improved my sex life!

I’ve been on lexapro for a year and half for anxiety.  I had such bad work anxiety that I had a breakdown and had to take a leave from work.  I started on 10 mg and it helped but I was still experiencing anxiety.  My doctor suggested 20 mg and it’s been a little over a year ago and I feel great now.  It has helped so much to enjoy my life and family.  Before I had such bad anxiety, I would just worry all the time about work and just had the worst case scenario outlook on everything.  I was so wound up, I snapped all the time at my family.  Not only that but I started to have GI and sleeping issues.  It was such a dark time for me.  However this medication has helped so much to get thing back into a balance for me.    Though it’s not going to be immediate.  It took about 6-8 weeks for the 20 mg dosage to really get into me where I could let things roll off of me, then another 6 month to get to a normal state where everything felt like it should be. So hang in there everyone.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I just started lexapro today, reading the side effects worry me some..so far a little Nausea. I do not need to get worse. The dr. started me on 20 MG. I have seen reading  that people were started on a lower dose? In a week I'll try to stop back in with how things are going

Lexapro (escitalopram):I struggled with anxiety for 10 years on and off.  Mostly on,  I was scared all the time and my brain felt fuzzy like I had a veil in front of my head.  I was starting to believe I was going to have a breakdown if something didn't change fast.  My Dr suggested   lexapro and as terrified as I was about taking it I was desperate.  Fast forward 7 months and wow, I am me again.... I can honestly say it gave me my life back.  The first few weeks were tough but I had an amazing friend who encouraged me to keep hanging in there.  The veil lifted , the fuzziness went away and there I was ( the real me ). I still get anxious occasionally but I can breathe through it.... Life is amazing

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was prescribed Lexapro about a month ago, they started me at 5mg the side effects I had were dry mouth, racing thoughts, terrible thoughts, restless, loss of appetite, insomnia, my right leg would uncontrollably shake on its own, and I felt like my stomach was burning. After about 2 weeks the side effects went away. Before Lexapro I would wake up everyday feeling like crap. I always had a headache and was always nauseous. Going to work was such a struggle I always got so anxious before work, driving was becoming scary, I feel like I was crying every other night, and I was easily irritated. The bad side effects made me want to lose hope in them but I kept taking them now I have noticed that I don't get nauseous, I don't get headaches as often as I used to, I don't panic at work (or before) and waking up have been easier. I recently got my dose raised to 10 mg and I feel like its been making me tired but I know that day by day I will get better! DO NOT LOSE HOPE!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I put off taking SSRI''s for years because I was terrified of the side effects. Even the thought of taking 2.5mg absolutely sent me into panic and I hesitated taking this medication due to my own anxiety but I regret not starting sooner! I have been on lexapro for 3 months and I've never felt better. Before starting, I was extremely agoraphobic to the point where I could barely walk two blocks from my house. I avoided making plans with friends etc. I now feel like I have my life back and NO SIDE EFFECTS!! I am currently on 5mg, and the first week was way better than I anticipated. Slight drop in appetite, headache and a little bit of increased anxiety and diarrhea  but nothing that we haven't experienced before! I am so grateful. Please please give this a try, it will change your life!!! Let me also note that I am extremely emetophobic and avoided taking this medication because I was afraid of any potential nausea or stomach issues, but ZERO. None. If I can do it, you can do it:)

Lexapro (escitalopram):I thought I would come back and share my updated experience because I think it can be very helpful.  It has been 1 month now on Lexapro and it has been somewhat of a rollercoaster, but it was worth it. Let me start off by saying LISTEN TO YOUR BODY! I started on 5mg and noticed the usual side effects, a week later I went up to 10mg and felt okay the first week. The 2nd week of being on 10mg was awful, my anxiety was intensified and I was having more panic attacks. I saw my doctor and she put me back down to 5mg, and I feel amazing! While everybody reacts to medication differently, the best piece of advice I have is to  be patient and make sure you listen to your body and be in contact with your provider. As my doctor told me, you should not have to suffer more than you already have been for a longer period of time!
Lexapro (escitalopram):It helped to a degree. My daily panic attacks stopped but didn’t go away. I still couldn’t do anything or go anywhere. I gained 60 pounds in 2 years on this medication.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro gave me back my quality of life. I was a beyond anxious nursing student with social anxiety who felt like I was deteriorating from the inside out. I cried multiple times a week and started isolating myself from friends as I was so fearful of the unknown. I always felt against taking medication but then gave in and can't imagine going back to how my life was before it. I am so much happier, sillier, and calm. I still have spouts of anxiety and obsessing, but I can more easily move past it and keep going, which I could never do before as it would literally consume me. The lexapro took about 10-12 weeks to fully work but I am so happy I waited it out. I also had no side effects except for vivid dreams. If you are thinking about it, do it! I think you'll be very happy with the results. Thanks lexapro for helping me find my confidence and overall self again.

This drug completely changed my life. From anxiety disorder where I my whole body was on such high alert for years that I was just treading water with the occasional drowning. I had headaches and a bit more anxiety for the first two weeks, but it settled quickly. On 10mg. Works so well. You know all that jazz about being calm and breathing and focus on mindfulness? I could never do it. I can do it now! Whoever invented this drug is a genius. I love it. I struggled for so long and had nasty gastro on sertraline and citalopram was useless. Escitalopram/lexapro is awesome. Been on it 4 months.

I started taking Cipralex  (escitalopram in the UK) 12 days ago for anxiety that seemed to come out of nowhere and it was affecting my sleep and daily life. I was prescribed 10 mg and started with that which was a big mistake. My anxiety immediately went through the roof, I couldn’t eat anything, had diarrhea, and my arms and hands went all tingly. The next day I went down to 5 mg and most of the side effects went away. For the next 5 days I still had increased anxiety, no appetite, and really bad trouble sleeping (only get max 4 hours a night) On the 4th day I went back up to 10 mg and the bad side effects didn’t come back. After the first 5 days I noticed my appetite come back and my anxiety has been decreasing each day. I feel more like my normal self again! One thing I’m still struggling with is sleep, my doctor prescribed Trazadone to help with this and it’s been hit or miss finding the right dosage for that but it’s helped a bit so far. I might switch to Clonazepam if I need to.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I need to start off by thanking everyone who has taken the time to share their positive reviews of Lexapro on this site. I’m 3 days into my prescription and my mind is racing. Starting August this year I had a health scare followed by a bout of terrible IBS. Triggering the worst anxiety I’ve ever experienced. I’ve lost 10 lbs in about a month. I’m pretty small to begin with! So I ended up in the ER last week. They said while I may have IBS it’s likely caused by uncontrolled anxiety. Referred me to a psychiatrist, a gastroenterologist and my primary care doc. I went to see my pcp this past Monday and she put me on 5mg’s of lexapro for 7 days and 10mg’s after that. So far dry mouth is my worst complaint, also have no appetite like forcing myself to eat and insomnia. Hoping the side effects which currently feel just as bad as the anxiety symptoms level off soon. I will report back after some time has passed.

I don’t understand why people write their negative reviews here about this drug after their first, second , fifth day of using this drug. People this drug takes at least A MONTH to kick in! And unfortunately during the first two weeks you may have increased anxiety and depression and other unpleasant things , which will go away. If you suffer from anxiety you MUST start with microscopic doses (2.5 mg) and go VERY VERY slowly up to the therapeutic dose of 10 mg or higher - such approach may take a couple of months. Most negative reviews here are written by the people who haven’t been patient enough . This drug DOES work , but you need to be at least one month on the therapeutic dose.

Hello, I should have updated sooner but going on 3 years on Lexapro! It has been life changing. I was absolutely against medication and felt like a failure but I made the best decision for myself and my family. (Mom of 2 boys and wife). I was on the edge all the time, suicidal thoughts were on high right after my first panic attack while driving and everything went down hill. I was constantly googling and hearing all the bad which stopped me many times but thankful I came across this page because it gave me hope! I recommend it 100%. Trust the process..

I have been taking this drug for 2 months. Just like many other people here I was anxious about taking this drug so I started with very small doses - 2.5 mg - 3 days, then 5 mg - 2 weeks, then 10 mg - 3 weeks, and finally 15 mg. This drug takes time to work and I think I am seeing the results now - I am calm, no anxiety, my mood is definitely better and more stable and instead of focusing on the negatives, I just automatically switch to positives. Regarding side effects - before taking the drug I was terrified of the prospect of being sexually dysfunctional - being unable to ejaculate or having a low libido. Guess what - I HAVE NOT experienced ANY of the side effects. If you do have problems with libido while on this drug, I recommend doing cardio and going to the gym - it really helps, but overall as I have seen this drug is not as bad as other SSRI regarding sexual side effects.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I suffered from anxiety for a long time, not even knowing I had it in the first place. Finally when I did my research I realized iIwas suffering from anxiety. At first I thought oh its just anxiety it will go away. But let me tell you this….IT DOESNT! The more stress I was in and the more changes were happening in my life the worse it got. I was at a point where I couldn't even go to a grocery store alone or for that matter anywhere alone. The racing heartbeat every time the overthinking and the panic attacks were terrifying me. I have always been scared to take any meds but when I realized that anxiety was taking my life away I decided to give this drug a try. I started with 2.5mg and slowly went up to 5mg. And never had to go higher cuz it has been working very well for me! No side effects and I’m back to my old self! I feel better, I sleep better, panic attacks went away, and I’m finally enjoying life again. Please give it a try its worth it! :))

Lexapro (escitalopram):Awful. It made me go insane to the point I had to ring the GP and cry down the phone that I was going mad because I couldn’t stop full body tremors and panic all day to the point my ribs are now permanently painful. It is an awful drug like the rest of the SSRIs. The only way to fix anxiety is resolve the underlying unless it truly is a serotonin problem. These made me absolutely manic and if you’re suffering the same please beg your GP to stop it and get support.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Today is day 12 of 5mg cipralex. The past 3 days have not been good. Anxiety all day. Very dizzy, and some mild nausea. Eating isn't good.  I read these posts and see this is normal?? I'm praying this helps me in the long run. This is a true test in patience. Thanks to all who have posted their experiences. It gives me hope.

So far very good response to the treatment for Anxiety and Depression marked by Insomnia.Started with 10 mg for 15 days and experienced the usual side effects.  I had all of them that were listed.  The first 3 days were the worst - had high anxiety because I had never been on anti-depressants before, the 7th day I experienced some benefits and was very calm, the 10 th day I got over most of the side effects.   On my 15th day I visited the Dr. and he upped my dose to 20 stating that I should get my energy back and see me in 30 days.  The 20 mg doses did not create any side-effects for me.  I continue to feel very normal just calm and easy going.  I have been hungry but my weight has not gone up.  I continue to work out and do yoga at the gym 5 days a week.  I am retired and have part-time work 1 day a week the rest of my time is focused on my health and golf.  Will give more updates after a few months.  This has been a life changing transformation for me now that I am able to sleep.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I'm on Day 5 of Lexapro - 10mg. I have been not liking how I feel it for the most part, zombie like, very tired, confused, difficulty focussing, feeling apathetic, and disassociating a bit. I know it's early days. I have had moments of clarity and I am definitely less anxious about things that would usually make me feel stressed. I was tempted to stop taking it today but having found this thread I will keep persevering for a few weeks. It's hard to cope with feeling WORSE than before...But I remain hopeful that these side effects will reduce over time.

Lexapro (escitalopram):About a month ago I experienced my first panic attack while driving and then it was just downhill since then, was getting completely anxious every time I had to drive. I started on 5mg of Lexapro 8 days ago and just increased to 10mg. I have had increased anxiety around more than just driving now which feels like an adrenaline rush, but goes away just as fast. I also have experienced nausea, dry mouth, and feeling dizzy/drowsy. The only symptom that got worse when I increased the dose so far was the dizziness which affects my vision to the point I cannot focus on one point. After reading all these reviews, I am very hopeful and plan to stick it out and can see the light at the end so THANK YOU! I was just wondering how people went about their lives during the first 2-3 weeks. I am in grad school and do not have the opportunity to just take the time off. Any recommendations on how to cope while continuing daily life activities?

It helps take the pain or discomfort of anxiety and depression away, but it also takes away other emotions in a subtle sense. It feels like a you can’t really process the breadth of human emotion and your personality is blunted in a way. Yes you might feel better and less prone to troublesome worries and feelings, but at what cost are you willing to trade? Then there’s the morning after agitation if you forget to take the medicine, and the god-awful withdrawal symptoms that make you feel dependent on it. When did needing a pill everyday to function become a long-term substitute? Perhaps a year or two might help you, but for a long-term solution I would seek other forms of therapy and activities. There’s so much contradictory studies and research that it’s almost frightening to think what we’re doing to our mental health. I can go on and on, but I do feel more like myself when I don’t take the pill.

Lexapro (escitalopram):(24, female) I understand a lot of people have had good experiences with this drug and I don't want to scare anyone off but I took it for the first time last night and it'll be the last time I take it. Woke up in the middle of the night in cold sweats, nauseated, palpitations, shaking like a leaf and had to wake my parents up and almost had to go into casualty but waited it out a bit and eventually the palpitations stopped after an hour and multiple phone calls with the doctor on call and nurses in casualty. I've taken meds with serotonin in the past and none of them have done this to me. The doctor will probably try cut the dose down from 10mg to 5mg but I will not be taking it, I'm far better off fighting my mental health issues the natural way than with drugs. I hope you're all okay and coping!!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I just took my fist dose of lexapro I’m at 10mg Reading all these reviews give me hope. I just want to be able to drive again without feeling like I’m going to pass out from a panic attack. I’ll hang in there these really gave me hope. I'm about an hour in and no side effects just yet

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started lexapro 13 weeks ago because my anxiety was making my life extremely difficult to stand there was days were I couldn’t sleep or really eat and I got to be honest lexapro did reduce my anxiety but sometimes I just feel empty or like out of place I can’t really describe it but other than that the lexapro really did help!

I was prescribed escitalopram shortly after I gave birth to my twins and developed PPD and GAD. I was at a point in my life where the anxiety I was experiencing was so bad that I couldn't even leave my house. My doctor started me off on a tapered dose and the anxiety became so bad that I returned to his office a few days later while having a full blown panic attack. He increased me to the full dose and prescribed me some Ativan to help counteract the initial side effects of the Escitalopram. This drug WILL make you feel worse before you feel better. It has been well documented that it does. For me it took about 4 months before I finally felt like it was working as intended and I was able to drop the Ativan completely. However, I have been on this drug @10mg for just over 2 years now and I'm starting to notice the anxiety come back. I have also noticed that I am tired all of the time, moody, irritable, and unmotivated. My doctor doesn't want to increase the dose due to the side effects.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Just wanted to share my experience of my first week on Lexapro - I drove myself to such an anxious place reading all the reviews about side effects, and I want to say I have had nothing bad at all, it made me mildly nauseous for the first 2 days but that was it. Every person is different, but I cannot stress enough how fine it has been starting 10mg! It took me 6 months before I found the courage to start these meds and I was so worried about side effects, but I'm glad I did. As soon as I took the first pill, I felt at peace with the decision and didn't look back. Haven't noticed a change in mood yet, but I am being patient as I know it takes a few weeks to kick in. Will comment back here once I notice anything!
Lexapro (escitalopram):I'm on day 7 of 5mg Lexapro. It had been a tough week. Nausea, insomnia feeling just blah. Hoping this will get better

Started taking escitalopram 6 months ago for anxiety and rumination thoughts on 20mg it works really well I don't worry anymore or overthink things. Only problem is I don't feel sad or happy I just numb.

Been on Lexapro now for 3 days and OH MY WORD, my anxiety has been so much worse. I struggle more and I feel like I'm at a dead end. I called my Dr and he said he will change my meds if I still feel this bad after 5 days of taking it but after reading many many positive reviews and especially realizing that the first week or so being bad is normal. I might stick it out for the week and try to get through it.Thank you to everyone who left reviews on their experiences.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have had anxiety my entire life, but for the most part I have managed it on my own. My therapist prescribed lexapro 5mg and then work up to 10mg. The side effects I experienced at first were nausea, headaches, and absolutely terrible restless insomnia. Then, after increasing my dose a month into taking it, I had an absolutely terrible experience. I had terrible intrusive thoughts that were completely against who I am. I had panic attacks that went on for days. I couldn’t sleep or eat. I was a different person, I felt like I had lost my mind and myself completely. It was the most terrifying experience I’ve ever had. I immediately stopped taking it and then the withdrawal began. The intense brain zapping feeling, the dizziness, the continuing anxiety attacks, the nightmares, the insomnia…. I feel like I was just pumping my body with poison. I will never take another medication again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I believe lexapro saved me. I have always suffered from OCD and anxiety, but believed I could deal with it myself without any help. Well, that all hit the fan after quarantining, having a tough breakup, and just feeling hopeless. I finally began experiencing physical pain from my anxiety and depression along with a racing heart and thoughts at night. I went to a few doctors and they all told me it was likely caused by anxiety and one of them prescribed me 10mg if lexapro daily. I looked at the bottle for weeks before deciding to take it. I felt like a failure for taking antidepressants, but within a few weeks, I couldn't believe, I was my natural happy self again. It didn't make me euphoric at all, only my true optimistic, laughing self again...the best part of me. I'm now in week 6ish or 7 I believe and I feel amazing. I also make the choice to be happy everyday. Lexapro helped get me to my natural self again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Hello everyone I just wanted to share my experience. This is the third time I started lexapro for GAD and panic attacks. I found out that the right dosage for me is 20mg (I’m a 23 year old and fit woman). Throughout the years, thanks to therapy, I learnt how to cope with anxiety and panic attacks, anyways one symptom that would never leave me and I could never learn how to cope with was air hunger/ breathlessness/ hyperventilation/ whatever. I had this symptom from the moment I woke up to the moment I went to bed: I was okay only when I was sleeping, and I thought I was going crazy and was insane. Started lexapro again after this symptom worsened, and as I said I started it for the third time in 5 years, and I can happily say that after 37 days (yes, I kept a journal) I am finally feeling like myself again. So if everyone else is struggling and reading this review, just hang in there, power through the first 2-3 weeks, it’s gonna be worth it!

After first two weeks I noticed a general feeling of well being more relaxed about things in general. I’m more complementary and considerate to my spouse.  Trivial matters no longer matter.. after three months of use I am very well pleased….

At first, it worked amazingly. For the first two days I felt great, so happy & no anxiety. Then after that, things progressively got worse & worse. I thought I was dead. Everything was black. I felt like I was having a horrible acid trip for two weeks straight. People terrified me. I was hearing things. I was going to commit suicide but my mom checked on me & told me to STOP TAKING IT. It was absolutely horrible.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Wow, I’m actually doing this lol. But I told myself if this works I would come back and tell my story. Now I don’t have an elaborate story that is super compelling. I was just a person who was struggling with intense anxiety and depression for a long period of time. It got to the point that I was pretty much having breakdowns everyday and would just go into my car and cry. After going therapy for a few months I noticed a small change but the feeling I had inside just wouldn’t go away. Eventually I started to think about trying medication. My doctor recommended I try Lexapro. At first I started at 10mg and after a couple weeks it was really helping and I was happy about that. But after about 5 weeks I had a honest conversation with my doctor and told him I feel there is another level I can get to. He said that is completely normal and recommended that I go up to 20mg. And let me tell you... after 3 months I can honestly say I am in a truly great place mentally.

I started taking this drug over 12 months ago due to depression and anxiety, also menopausal....does it ever end for us ladies.I took 10mg for 9 months and I slept better, however anxiety (social) and day fatigue plus feeling of hopelessness didn't waiver, therefore  my dose was upped to 20mg and I am getting on track.  I go shopping and walks, still can't be in crowded space but  staring to see the light and writing this I smile as 4 months ago I wouldn't be able see the reviews for crying.Highly recommend from a strong woman that nothing could touch/bring down, anyone! Any age! Any sex! Any race can suffer this debilitating illness and we all need help to climb out of that hole.Don't be ashamed or embarrassed....go get the help you deserve and look after YOU!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I just wanted to share my experience with Lexapro 10 mg.  So out of the blue I started to experience pretty severe anxiety.  A lot was going on in my life at the time (working and going to grad school, renovating a house by myself, unhealthy relationship) and my brain was on absolute overdrive.  I wasn't sleeping and was having panic attacks everyday multiple times a day.  My mother recommended Lexapro and it changed my life.  My anxiety got worse the first two weeks but after that the symptoms began to taper and I started sleeping better again.  From my experience, I didn't start to feel 100% for about a month or two.  There's something absolutely critical you have to understand about this medicine, it's dulls the symptoms but DOES NOT fully cure them.  For me, working on myself mentally, getting exercise, eating right, and taking back my life in addition to the medicine helped tremendously and my doctor agrees this is the way you should handle this medicine.  No magic pills here.

I was so scared before taking this medicine because of the side effects I had heard about, but I’m so glad that I read all reviews here and decided to start with this medication against my problems with anxiety, panic attacks stress in general. I started at 5mg for 2 weeks and yes I had some side effects as nausea, headache increased anxiety but it was okay, then after 2 weeks increased to 10mg and after 2 More weeks I’m now on 15 mg and feel so much better. So I hope for everyone who has problem with some sort of depression, anxiety, panic attacks etc to try this medication!! Don't be afraid of side effects it is worth it in the end. So now after almost 2 months I'm so much better :)

Lexapro (escitalopram):Just wondering if everyone is taking the  expensive brand Lexapro or the generic form of Lexapro. I started out on 10 mg of generic Lexapro and it saved my life. I felt great for 3 months then my symptoms came back. My psychiatrist claims that the last batch of generic Lexapro  was probably a bad batch. So he upped my dose to 20mg, of generic Lexapro that made me really sick. Now I am taking 15mg of generic Lexapro and still sick. I am going to try 5mg of generic Lexapro . If that doesn't work I am contemplating taking the expensive brand of Lexapro. I also take 7.5 mg of mirtazapine at.5p.m. Has anyone taken generic Lexapro and switched to the brand Lexapro? Was there any improvement? Any thoughts?

Lexapro (escitalopram):After a year of being on 10mg of Lexapro, it’s 100% apparent to both myself and my loved ones that it has saved my life. It’s astounding how different I am now compared to where I was at last year mentally. I used to have horrible crying spells, I would scream uncontrollably, and had terrifying anxiety attacks. Lexapro helped me to become my old self again and helps me to control/better regulate my emotions. I can honestly say that I feel like a brand new person! The first few months I had some side effects- twitching/spasms in my fingers and very vivid/crazy dreams, but these side effects were pretty tolerable and went away eventually. Everyone’s bodies will react differently, but I highly recommend Lexapro. Best of luck to all of you in finding the right medication!

What a rollercoaster! The beginning was tough I’m not going to lie. I had every imaginable side effect. I was prescribed 10 mg but took 5 mg for about 2 weeks. It was awful, I had heightened anxiety, panic attacks, irritability, tiredness, etc. I wanted to quit everyday, but continued to persevere. I upped the dose to 10 mg and had heightened anxiety, and the symptoms all over again. After 3 weeks and a total of 5 weeks using lexapro I feel AMAZING! Completely worth the uphill battle. My brain is thinking clearly I have little to no anxiety and I am jumping out of bed each morning. Don’t pay attention the negative keep going! You got this!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I just wanted to come back onto this site and share my experience with lexapro so far. My anxiety used to be so bad I was in a constant state of panic most days and always had thought of impending doom. I cried at the drop of a dime. It was literally ruining my relationship and friendships. I was constantly tired and angry at the world. I had talked to my Dr and we both decided I should give lexapro a try. I was very hesitant at first but I picked up my prescription of 5 mg. The first couple of days were terrible I'm not going to lie to you. I had intense brain fog, brain zaps, I would fall asleep and wake up with intense anxiety. But you know what got me through that? the reviews on THIS site! Telling me it was going to be okay and give it a chance! I told my Dr my symptoms and she prescribed me a small dose of xanax to take before bed. Fast forward to 4 months later I am a totally different person but still have small bouts of anxiety here and there but its manageable! Good luck:)

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on Lexapro for 2 weeks.  I don’t notice anything different with my depression and anxiety.  No side effects.  Nothing.  How long does it take??  I’ve been on many other antidepressants before and they all started working in one week.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’m on day 1 of 10mg.  The panic/anxiety has been unbearable. My doctor suggested it last year, but I just did not want to be on a daily med for it.  After a move and job change the anxiety ramped up to almost daily panic attacks causing me to pass out.  After my husband found me unconscious he insisted I take my doctor up.  So today was first day and I had to leave work early-nauseated and anxiety hit.  I’m pushing through it.  All these reviews are giving me hope it’ll get better. I’ll post again after a month.

This medication and these reviews helped me get out a deep depression, as well as constant struggles with anxiety. There was a time when I had a really hard time seeing a way out, when it was all in my head. This medication helped me see that and assess my situation rationally. Don't be embarrassed about taking care of your mental health. You come first, always.

After 5 years I find it hard to get off escitalopram without major withdrawal effects. I am trying to taper off very slowly but even going down by 1mg from 5mg causes me fatigue. It dulls all emotions hence the anxiety relief. It did not help my chronic depression. Sometimes it causes fatigue which is very destabilising. I gained 13kg from increased appetite and decreased physical activity. Sexual sensitivity was reduced greatly to the point that in some instances I couldn't orgasm. I lost interest in my hobby and didn't fully enjoy anything else either. I didn't have clarity nor motivation. The feelings you can feel inside your body were gone. Dead silent. Apathy was very strong. This is not a good way to live life.If I could choose a different medication 5 years ago I would. I am currently on bupropion and it helps anxiety and depression and all the things that escitalopram has damaged. However, when I have a bad day from escitalopram the bupropion doesn't help.

After MUCH hesitation to ever get help for my crippling anxious thoughts and mild to severe depression, I finally made an appointment with a psychiatrist and got prescribed this wonderful medicine. I didn’t start noticing it working until after at-least a week, but man… it works. Let me tell you. I took 10mg for 8 days followed by 20 mg daily. I have never felt better. I use it in conjunction with exercise and therapy. Life changing. I recommend.

I have been taking lexapro for 4 weeks now. The anxiety and panic attacks hit me as I was recovering from COVID. The first couple of weeks were tough. I don't think the meds made me more anxious, but it took a few weeks for them to help me be calm. The nausea and the extreme insomnia were the worst part - I was only getting 2-3 hours total of sleep per night (and not uninterrupted sleep). The insomnia has gotten better. I take CBD gummies before bed and that has helped. My new Dr. actually did bloodwork to see if there was something contributing to my anxiety. Turns out I had almost no progesterone, which can cause anxiety and panic. She started me on a prescription cream and it is helping. I am also taking sublingual B12, which also helps with anxiety. I still have days with some anxiety- I teach school and the weekends cause me to be a bit nervous anticipating the week to come, but I haven't had a panic attack in awhile.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been taking Lexapro for 2 months and one week ago my DR raised my dosage to 15mg.  I have yet to see the upside and feel very very tired and still face the morning anxiety jitters. Going to stick with this with hope that a few more weeks will lessen the anxiety . Have any of you felt this while increasing your dosage.Thank you all for the positive reviews, so uplifting.

By far the worst antidepressant I have ever been on. I have never felt my symptoms get ten times worse with any types of this medication in the past and not to mention the physical symptoms! Dry mouth, sweating, shaking, insomnia and the nausea was unbearable. Was so glad I went to my doctor and he took me off this!

Back in 2018 I went away on vacation, one morning I woke up super dehydrated and didn’t realize how dry my mouth was until I couldn’t swallow. I started to panic and noticed my heart pounding out of my chest. I feared the worst and rushed to the emergency room where they didn’t find anything. For the following month I continued to feel like my heart was always racing and I that something was very wrong with me. After a full cardiac work up they told me that it was all anxiety driven. I started on lexapro 10mg. The first couple weeks I was still very anxious. At the 2 week mark I felt okay enough to travel for a weekend away. I had my good days and my bad but I fought hard to tell myself it was all in my head. After a month I was very close to being back to normal and after about 6 months of living stress & anxiety free I started to taper off of it. It worked for me and it can work for you too!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Started very slow with Lexapro. I have been on 10 mg for about a month now, without feeling that it was having much of an impact on my severe anxiety. (I have OCD as well) I decided to try 15 mg, which I have been on for a few days now and I feel that was a great move as my anxiety seems to finally be decreasing. I may eventually try 20mg. Overall the only side effects that I have noticed (and this could be attributed to other things) is a little weight gain and some tiredness throughout the day. I’ve tried to combat this with exercise, mindful eating and caffeine. I plan to stay on it for now, but I would suggest increasing the doseage if you are not feeling a difference. Here’s to continuing on!

Lexapro (escitalopram):My advice,  If you take this medication you had best be under extreme supervision.  As for some, like me,  it was exceptionally helpful, for less than a month and It completely destroyed my life and mind after. After 2 weeks off of it, I can control myself again and feel again. Be warned. These medications are in there infancy and they don't really understand,  the true implications of these types of medications.  My uneducated opinion

Dealing with strong Anxiety and everyday panic attacks and depression for years, started taking Cipralex 10mg, first week was insane, had worst panic attacks like never before, anxiety too, second week was bit easier, now I'm in to 5th week and guys this medicament is Amazing!Had so many situations this last 10 days in which normally I would overthink and panic so bad, but with this pills I was totally chill, enjoying moments, being myself again, it really takes time to get better , but it is insanely good medicament.Wow!

I love this medication. It makes me not obsess over silly things, and I feel like I can finally move on from abusive life situations. It also helps me manage daily panic and anxiety attacks, and life long depression, which I have had since my teens because of being bullied in middle school, in high school and again my 20s. The only downsides are nightmares every night (hyperactive dreaming), constipation, and weight gain. But these are worth it for feeling better. Give it a try, this medication can change your life :)

Lexapro (escitalopram):Had depression and anxiety for years and never dealt with it. Hit a big wall during Covid....panic attacks, suicidal thoughts, just awful stuff. Connected with my Dr and prescribed 10mg daily. First two weeks were awful as expected....should have taken some time off work. But man, I'm in my third month and my edges are softened, I tolerate a lot more, I'm doing things I love again and the bad thoughts are gone!!! The best is the fact my kids noticed that I'm not as angry, sad, unpredictable and unstable. Huge!!! It's tough at first, have your support ready....but wow

Today is Day 44 since starting Escitalopram 20mg. Started with 1/2 pill for 2 weeks then increased to a full. Increased anxiety had me at the doctor's for some Lorazepam 0.5mg. Which was great. Loved how calm it made me during work, with the odd yawn. But the 7 pills didn't last 7 days and anxiety increased. Two more Lorazepam prescriptions later, I was becoming dependent on them. I also started to get restless leg syndrome and my calf muscles would ache. Lorazepam also helped with that. But I knew that I was getting dependent to need Lorazepam to feel alright. Been 1 week since stopping Lorazepam. I wish it didn't cause such a dependency because it really did help. The RLS and leg cramping was still there, I was thinking it must be a Benzo withdrawal symptom. But it never went away. So I decreased the escitalopram to 15mg and the symptoms were virtually gone the next day and completely gone afterwards. Will update specifically about the effectiveness on my anxiety in 2 weeks.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been taking escitaloprám for 13 weeks, for anxiety, started 5mg for 6 weeks, then 7.5mg for 4 weeks been taking 10mg for 4 weeks, I still have anxiety and burning skin sensations and a tense head and my sleep is still not good.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I must say , I have always been scared of taking any kind of medicine. I always had anxiety, but it was manageable. About 4 months ago I started having full blown panic attacks and unable to drive due to them. They would come at all different times. At night was the worst too. The panic was so severe that I was dizzy, had heart pain, couldn't swallow, and felt horrible.  I finally decided to go to the Dr. After numerous tests all coming back normal. And being told it was in fact anxiety I was prescribed 10mg of lexapro. It's now almost 4 weeks being on it and I am much calmer, can drive again and NO panic attacks or anxiety!! I think around 3 weeks is when I really started feeling better and myself. I am so glad I decided to try it!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Hi just on day 4 and feel normal today after anxiety from menopause, I didn't want to take drugs but given up a while ago. Taking this at night but sleep not as good but that OK .  Also I have a lack appetite but I know that will settle.  I was  wondering if anyone else lost interest in food and when I eat I feel full fast? But definitely feeling calmer

Lexapro (escitalopram):Current on day 12 of 10mg Lexapro, after being on 5mg for 2 weeks while tapering off Effexor. Around the 8th day on 10mg I started to have awful side effects: headaches, nausea, emotions all over the place, stomach upset, diarrhea, loss of appetite, anxiety and panic. Just an overall sense of fear and hopelessness. Now at day 12 I am still feeling nauseous, loss of appetite, anxious and emotional. Stomach isn’t as upset and my headache is gone. I am hoping that I start to feel a bit better each day. I am grateful for all the reviews on here that tell me to stick with it and keep going; without reading these I may have given up by now. I will write another review in a few weeks to update how I’m feeling. Thanks everyone for your reviews!
In to my first week of exolopram so far so good just headaches and get weird feelings through my Head and brain every now and again. Anyone else?

Lexapro (escitalopram):Anyone reading this wondering when you’ll feel better, take it from me, it takes at least a few weeks to feel a solid difference & definitely at least 6 for relief. The first week can be worse as you encounter anything from yawning, dry mouth, fatigue, nausea & ironically, MORE anxiety. This is totally NORMAL & means the medicine is working & your body is adjusting to it. Hang in there as sweet relief is on the other side of this pain. I had been on 10mg previously for a few years & made the silly mistake of thinking I was better & didn’t need it anymore. Big mistake. Huge. After I had successfully weaned myself off it by tapering my dosage over a few weeks, I started to feel absolutely horrible. This awful feeling of dread, increased anxiety & insomnia made me reach for the lexapro again. I’ve been back on it for nearly 3 weeks now & only just starting to feel better. This morning was the first time I didn’t wake up in a mild panic & ruminating over stuff.

I developed anxiety disorder as I recovered from COVID. The anxiety/panic buzz is so bad. I am a teacher and the panic involves being back at work. Dr put me on lexipro. Today is day 3. Last night I didn't sleep at all. It is hard to know how to fill the day on the weekend. Thanks everyone for the stories about pushing through until the medicine takes effect. I have a few Xanax left but my current Dr does not prescribe it. I am hanging on to the few I have left to help me make it through class.

Started this 7 days ago, after effexor made my anxiety way worse to where I had the worst panic attack in my life for no reason. It's day 7 and I haven't had to take a xanax to calm down today (my doctor prescribed a few for when things get bad). I know it's early but I'm a lot calmer even now, the side effect I've been having is almost like zoning out, and that something is just off I'm my head, I'm not complaining, because it's way better than that constant feeling of something is terribly wrong that come with anxiety. I'm on 10mg starting and we will how it continues later to see if the dosage needs to be upped.

I’m on week 5 of lexapro. My first 2 weeks were absolutely horrible because of the side effects. I started taking this medication to help me with my insomnia. I was experiencing extreme anxiety around bed time and I would sometimes sleep 1 hour a night for weeks in a row. This started affecting my relationship with my husband and my children. After being on lexapro for 5 weeks, I am starting to feel less anxious at bed time. I also didn’t realize how bad my anxiety was for many other things in my life until I didn’t feel it anymore. This medication is really working so far but I’ve only felt it’s effect for a week now so let’s hope it keeps working because it’s life changing not only for me but for the people around me too.

Lexapro (escitalopram):My first panic attack was after Christmas of 2020. I went to the doctor and was prescribed lexapro 10mg. I did not take the medication at first because I did not want to be dependent on it. Four months later around April I went to the ER for a foot pain and I had a panic attack, heart rate was 170 bpm. They immediately did an EKG and ultrasound and it came out normal. The doctors from the ER advised me to take my medication and so I did. The first week of taking lexapro was horrible. I was not able to function. I was afraid of watching TV, sitting down, going outside, and going to sleep. My doctor prescribed me propranolol 10mg to help the symptoms of my anxiety such as a high heart rate, which helped. After the first week of taking lexapro, I felt way better. My heart rate was within the normal range of 86-96pbm and I was able to function daily.  Please take your medication and know that you are not alone!

I am on lexapro 13 days now but 7 of those days were half of a 5 mg dose and 1 dose was missed My anxiety is not any better I thought my insomnia was better because I actually slept two days in a row but last night I only got 2 hours sleep. Why would this be? and when will I see relief? Does the fact that I was taking half the dose at first and missing the one have anything to do with me not seeing any improvement yet

Where do I start ! Ok I went to my family doctor and I complained about anxiety. And she prescribed ecistalopram. Omg the first day I took it, I thought I was going crazy. I was so anxious I couldn’t sleep, I was suicidal all of a sudden. I ended up calling the ambulance but the police showed up to take me to the emergency room and then the psych ward. I was discharged 3 days after, I’m being hopeful and still taking the drug. But the side effect is no joke, I couldn’t be normal in public because I got more anxious

I have suffered with severe anxiety and depression since I was in high school.. maybe earlier. This past year it got so bad I was in a constant state of panic. I didn’t feel like there was a light at the end of my tunnel. I finally took a leap and brought it up to my family doctor. I don’t typically take medications.. but she recommended lexapro. I’ve had it sitting on my bathroom counter for a week.. terrified of the starting side effects or the withdrawals if I decided to quit. After reading your reviews.. I am in tears and feel like I am in the same place most of you were. And my tears are not coming from a sad or fearful place - I now see there is a light at the end of the tunnel and it is worth going through whatever hardships I may face to get to that light. Thank you all for opening my mind and easing my heart. I will start tonight and I will review again in a month with my actual experience. So thankful I came across this.
