Lexapro (escitalopram):I write this in hopes that there's someone that reads it and decides to try Lexapro, where they may have otherwise been too intimidated. My anxiety has been controlled for many years while using lexapro but I recently had a bout and forgot how awful life could be when anxious. For two week period my entire life was consumed with physical and mental symptoms of anxiety. I upped my dose of Lexapro, and felt better within a weekIt does take time to kick in upon initial administration, but give it time, it could change your life.I have had to increase my dosage twice, which does concern me, but I started with 10 mg which was effective then had to go to 15 mg, and recently just started with 20 mg.In my case, the anxiety was 24/7, it never went away, it Consumed my thoughts, it's all I ever thought about, and with lexapro, over a period of time, you just stop thinking about it less and less until it's no longer an issue.

Had nasty anxiety for a solid year. Nothing really seemed to be triggering it. Nothing that would give me crippling anxiety. I just wasn't myself anymore and I felt awful all day every day. I'd lay there wondering out loud if I was just going to feel like this for the rest of my life. Real doom and gloom. I'd get major medical issues in my head and be convinced that was what was making me feel bad. Like I had blood clots in my legs that were breaking off and getting in my lungs. Even at the time I knew it was silly but I was still just convinced my ticket was about to be punched. I bring it up because this little story might resonate with someone out there. If it does, if persistent, day long, miserable anxiety has its claws in you that's where I was two months ago.Escitalopram pulled me out. Took half at 10mg tablet once a day for a week then up to the full tablet. Took two weeks to kick in and that persistent anxiety is gone. Stick with it. It helps that awful persistent anxiety.

Started Escitalopram UK for major depression and anxiety ( breathing problems ).  First week or so was hard , 10mg I could’t get out of bed , vomit, cold sweats , leg cramps, had a panic attack after each morning dose , stuck it out and moved up to 20mg which stopped the panic attacks and depression lifted very quickly . I was where you are now , reading reviews hoping for an end to the suffering … it is a slow process but 18 months on I’m depression and about 90% anxiety free . Long term side effects are weight gain about 2 stone , as I just don’t feel as guilty after eating bad foods lol and a bit of emotional blunting but all in it saved my life .

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was prescribed lexapro for severe anxiety caused by GAD and a bad breakup.  But, honestly,  I think I had been struggling with depression my whole life, and didn't realize because it was just my normal feeling. Now, I feel actual happiness radiating from my chest instead of the stress knots that were there more times than not. I'm am slower to react and I rarely get angry anymore. I wish that I could feel this way naturally,  but I can't at this moment , and this is helping me immensely.

Lexapro (escitalopram):First I started using sertraline 4 years back and this last May it stopped working so my doctor thought switching meds might be worth a go plus I had heard great things about Lexapro. First I had to cross taper from sertraline and started on 5mg of lexapro. I was feeling okay, increased anxiety and was beyond exhausted but remembered it was like this for me before and that med worked for me for awhile so I kept going. My doctor had me up to 10mg and that’s where things went from okay to bad to worse. I was waking up 5am every morning in full panic attack. My husband would have to give me a .5 Xanax and lay with me until I went back to sleep. The days got worse, no concentration, motivation and my mood was generally don’t care about everything. After two weeks I went back to my doctor sobbing and he agreed we needed to get back down to 5mg to see if that was a better dosage for me and If it’s not I’ll titrate down off that. Will update again in 2 weeks.

I took this at 20mg for approx. 4 weeks then had to stop as the side affects were insane. Shaking, tremors, sweating, panic attacks were what I was suffering before hand due to leaving an incredibly abusive relationship. This particular medication increased those situations 100 fold. It did not work for me. In fact I bordered on psychosis after taking them.. Took myself off these very quickly.

*I will update again in 2 weeks*Today is Day 23 since starting Escitalopram 10mg. And Day 9 since increasing to 20mg. Take it for social and GAD. I also have IBS, TMJ and Epilepsy. Most likely all related in one way or another. Been on CBD oil for 3 years. After a panic attack at work, I knew I needed something different. My job requires perfection and speed. Changing jobs may help or may not. Since I know I have these conditions wherever I go.Anyways. Felt dizzy and jittery first few days. Then started to feel calmer, cheerful and social after the 1st week. Which now I think was a placebo effect, because it didn't take much until I began to feel anxious and down. I increased it thinking it wasn't enough and I know that there can be an increase in anxiety side effect. I will say that it has helped my IBS. I don't feel the pain of dread in my chest when I make a mistake at work, but the anxiety is still there. I will give it 2 more weeks. Reading comments for encouragement.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started taking Lexapro for racing thought and anxiety. I have the kind of anxiety where I get flustered and panicked sore of quick and have a hard time handling certain situations. I also have social anxiety as well. I initially took 5mg of Lexapro the first week to sort of acclimate my body and then moved to 10 mg. The side effect were very mild. I got the yawns a lot, sort of drowsy and a little bit of loss of appetite. After taking 10mg for months that went away and I noticed that my social anxiety was a lot better and I was able to handle situations with more grace. I feel like I hit the ceiling with 10 mg and it wasn’t really working for me anymore, so I moved up to 15mg. It gave me that extra boost I needed. The only negative side effect at all for me is a decline in my sexual drive. Sooo heads up, it does so that. Every now and then I will skip a day so that my sex drive will sort of come back for a day. Hope this helps!

If you’re reading reviews because you’re in a dark, desperate place and you’re terrified that these feelings will never go away, this is for you. 5 weeks ago, I was you. I was here, reading, searching for hope, in a months-long spiral of horrific panic attacks and unimaginable anxiety, unable to drive, afraid to be alone, afraid to eat, triggered by everything, losing weight. I felt like I needed to check into a hospital. I wanted it all to end, even if it meant my life. I pushed through some initial side effects (increased anxiety, GI symptoms, a short bout of insomnia) and after about 5 weeks, my life has changed. I’m a completely different person (in the best way) than I was a month ago. I’m able to feel more peace, confidence, happiness. I don’t feel scared all the time. I was in the worst condition I’ve ever been in, I thought I was beyond help, but I wasn’t. I’m here to tell you that you are not alone. There IS hope, and you are worth it.

Currently taking 5mg, on day 4. The first three days were bad, couldn't sleep, had no appetite, no libido, had nausea, cold feet, was lightheaded and very anxious (I was overthinking every little symptom 24/7) - when I consulted my doctor she told its like I'm the beginning and I should keep taking it. Now it's day 4, in the morning I could make an important call, finish tasks and finally eat more (also the nausea is almost 100% gone). My anxiety level is fluctuating a lot, but no attacks so far. It's too early to rate, so I'll come back after taking 10mg in the 2nd week.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro gave me my life back. Brought me back to the feeling and experiences of my happiest times of my life. After post-partum depression, losing my husband at a young age, and a year later losing my mom. Lexapro saved me. I was able to graduate with my master’s degree and now raise my two small children effectively. I wake up everyday with gratitude.

I can’t get myself to take a second dose of lexapro. I was prescribed 10 mg for anxiety and I took it at dinnertime as instructed. By the time I got in bed I felt a little nauseous and I woke up around midnight and started throwing up. I laid awake all night long feeling the spins and like my mind was racing static. It is now 10am the next day and I still feel nauseous. I will not be furthering my medication journey, as I’m realizing this is a much harder process to get into and honestly if you’re not at rock bottom it’s just not worth it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have a most debilitating anxiety. I'm one week in and it seems like my anxiety is at an all time high but everyone in the comments are saying it gets worse before it gets better. I'm sticking with it in hopes that's true. I get so nervous and shaky. It's embarrassing. So far, it has helped me lose weight because I hardly have an appetite on it. I started taking it in the morning but it gives me energy and kept me awake so I started taking it in the mornings instead. I'm taking vistaril at night to help me through this rough patch. It's making me yawn a lot and I feel a little bit of nausea when I first take it but then it goes away quickly. I have been able to calm myself down faster when I get worked up. I hope things get better.

On week 5 1/2.  5 mg dose first week then 10mg.  Some nausea and diarrhea first two weeks but bothersome and concerning loss of appetite.  Heard this side effects happen and hope it resolves soon as I've lost 20 lbs,   making myself eat. Just past week began waking at 3 am anxious and hope that passes too.  Anxiety is muted and no panic attacks for two weeks.   Internal heat and burn is improved this week but still present frequently.   Have needed Ativan more this week than last mainly for sleep.  Overall feeling like I'm trending in right direction and heard from others to give it time.     Encouragement welcomed as is similar experiences.  I can't rate it yet because it hasn't reached full effectiveness, I hope.
Lexapro (escitalopram):I find it doing a fine job but wish sexual side effects were lesser, but overall good medication.

Started 10mg of escitaloprám for anxiety. I have been on them for 12 days so far, the side effects have not been to bad, muscle aches, upset tummy grumbling a lot and diarrhea, I take them at night luckily have not had insomnia but also have been taking magnesium at night, have trouble waking up or staying awake in I'm not liking is the grumpiness I have towards my children I have just noticed myself growling a lot more then usual. I am going to give it a few months before I make any decisions as it might pass with time since I have only been on them less then 2 weeks. I have felt my anxiety is lessened, it is still there but just not as strong.I will update after 3 months see if any changes happen.

I was prescribed Lexapro a couple weeks ago to help with anxiety. I think it is important to share the not so great side effects that may not be listed as common side effects. I took it a total of 2 days in the morning and by the 2nd night my body was rejecting the medication.  I noticed the 2nd day I felt very tired, but knew it was common to feel that way so I kept pushing through. I also had completely lost my appetite and did not want to eat. I woke up around 3 am to use the bathroom the 2nd night and when I was sitting on the toilet I became very nauseous. I got very hot, faint, and could not pee at all. Although urine retention is not common it can happen. I spent an entire day in bed and forced myself to eat. I monitored my urination and still had very little output. I immediately stopped this medication after only 2 days!! If you are experiencing this please know you are not alone and that everything will be ok! It will take full 5-7 days to get out of your system.

It’s only day 3 and I’ve been feeling this sense of joy in my stomach that doesn’t go away. More energy and better mood! I was afraid to try meds, probably because of my anxiety. I’m glad I tried without it but at the same time I probably should’ve tried this a long time ago. 10/10

I am on day 5 of taking the drug after being diagnosed general anxiety syndrome with frequent panic attacks. The first few days were absolutely awful and the worst I've ever felt with constant panic attacks and crying and shaking all day. I nearly stopped taking it but last night I read the reviews here which encouraged me to power through so I took the next tablet and woke up this morning feeling 1000 times better. I did not have the feeling of dread and fear and have not cried all day. I do not know how I will feel tomorrow but today I feel like I have been freed of something awful. Keep going. You can do it and you deserve to feel well again!

Hi guys,I am week 3 on lexam 10mg.I read all these reviews before I started them. First time taking them I got very dizzy felt drunk . And got a hot flush and my face felt like it was on fire, even though we  were in winter. I had no suicidal thoughts or side effects apart from the first day only. I have been waking up with a blood shot blurry vision on my left eye. Today I was demoted and I have hit a wall couldn’t stop crying and felt very down. I feel in general my thoughts and moods have not changed at all since taking this and I am still having trouble trying to sleep at when my head hits the pillow that is when my anxiety creeps in.Is this normal for only starting them 3 weeks ago ? I have called my dr but can not get a hold of her till tomorrow so I will ask about my eye and my feelings for today. But just seeing if anyone else has had this experience. Thank you
Lexapro (escitalopram):Made me sweat a lot, have vivid dreams but only got better after a month

Lexapro (escitalopram):Please do not take this medication. I took two pills for two days and it nearly finished  me  with the worst side effects. It's been over a year since I took this drug and I still don't feel right. Please do not take this

Lexapro (escitalopram):On these 5 years find them very helpful for my anxiety, took about 3 or 4 months to start working effectively. Feel much calmer now. I never had any side effects at all. I'm coming off them soon as. I think I don't need them anymore. As I'm on enough medication for other conditions I'll see how it goes.

Lexapro (escitalopram):My problem started 5 years ago. After some struggling in my carrier, my anxiety started to get worse (I’m a perfectionist so I have anxiety quite often). I first started with Paxil. It went well about 6 months but the side effects of sex drive is really bad so the doctor changed to lexapro. After 3 months my sex problem was getting better, not perfect but better. I had lexapro for 4 years and it work pretty good on my emotion. I see the world in positive way. I care less about things that I shouldn’t care. I focus more on things and people I love. Still there are some side effects remain such as drowsiness, weight gain or tiredness but they’re all bearable compare to the anxiety I has suffered. I tried to wean off 2 times but it last only 2-3 months before relapsed . So I guess it’s my long time companion and it’s a true friend. .Tips : You can feel worse after taking any antidepressants for first week (or two) but trust me it will be better.

Lexapro (escitalopram):My biggest regret is that I did, not discover this drug years ago. I lived in fear and panic for years with bouts of horrible depression. Started on 5mg and I am now on 15mg daily. Please note people that when you start taking Lexapro first you will feel some side effects. I felt restless, prickling in my arms, tremors and difficulty concentrating. The good news is that this will all disappear after 7 to 14 days, it's just your system getting used to the drug..Try and stick it out, folks. Lexapro saved my life

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’m currently starting my fourth week on Lexapro 10mg and I can really tell it’s working. The first couple weeks I was definitely more anxious and agitated but by week 3 I’ve felt so much better and calmer. If you can hang in there through the increased anxiety at first it will be worth it! I also haven’t experienced any side effects other than feeling a little more tired on week 3 but I think that’s just because my anxiety is a lot better on this medication.

Lexapro (escitalopram):After being on Ativan for over 20 years for anxiety and panic attacks, I'm working with my new pcp to transition to another med. Buspar didn't work so I'm now on day 2 with Lexapro. I rushed to read the reviews because I have a nervous, odd emotional feeling. I sit staring blankly into space and feel uneasy. I took my 2nd pill after being up for an hour this morning and immediately went back to bed and slept for 2 hours. Am on 10mg. I might cut back to 5mg tomorrow. Am hopeful based on the long term outcomes many have had but I had planned to go grocery shopping today and don't think I have the emotional strength to do it...afraid of a panic attack and am feeling too unbalanced. Just took an ativan so am hoping that evens me out to at least get through the day. I'm hopeful, but this is difficult and it's only day 2! Thank you for your reviews. I hope to reach the level of calm that many have described but it's obviously going to be a bumpy ride. I'll fasten my seatbelt.

Suffering from depression and anxiety.  Started on escitalpram  5 weeks ago, 5 mg for 2 weeks and now have been on 10 mg 4 /5 weeks ( so total of 6 and a half weeks). Anxiety has got worse and worse and now has gone through the roof; shaking, sweating, feeling nauseous and scared I am going mad.  Is there hope that it will soon start to improve things.? or does this very long very rough start mean I am not suited to it?   Any answers gratefully received

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro generic’s can vary a little, so keep that in mind, regardless as to being told they are all Exactly the same. This medication has removed all panic attacks, made driving more relaxing and flying far more enjoyable. I think I have a build in Caution response to things since turning around 35-40 years old. Caution can become panic and it is no fun for us sufferers. For Me this has been the ideal medication other than slightly less sexual drive..but not completely. 20mg daily for me at 200lbs.

Lexapro (escitalopram):About 2 months ago I started having severe panic attacks, I was then put on Prozac and had a horrible side effect and then on another med which was even worse. I researched Lexapro and got prescribed 5 mg for a week then upped it to 10mg. At the time I couldn’t go anywhere without having a near panic attack and only Xanax would help calm me down. I couldn’t sleep well taking Lexapro at night so on week 2 of 10 mg I started taking it in the morning instead. It made my anxiety almost worse at first but I just kept sticking w it after reading reviews. I’m so glad I did. It didn’t actually start working well until week 4 of 10 mg and now I’m at week 6 and I can finally go anywhere without having a panic attack and I’m finally back at work. This med saved my life . Stick with this med. it takes 4-6 weeks to start working!!! It will be worth it.
I do not recommend this medicine at all. Side effects are worse. Had suicidal thoughts and it took 3 days to come out of it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Around 5 years on lexaproBetween 10mg to 15mg dose all the time. It definitely saved my life :)Now after along time panic attacks and depression came back al ittle So I’m upping the dosage to 20 mg. But I’m sure it will work!A bit side effects nothing serious.

Lexapro (escitalopram):The drug made me happy and definitely took the edge off, however, it made me mentally weak. I capitulated easily to peers, spouse, clients, and ultimately alcohol. For 8 months, I needed alcohol mentally. Could not go a day without having a drink and was hiding it. I was never and alcoholic and never will be. Lexapro made me soft and took my will power away. I said yes to everything easily when all my life I have been a tough man with will power strong as a bull. I decided to go off it slowly 3 months ago. I could not care less about alcohol now. I don't need it, I work out daily, I eat well, I look excellent for almost 50 and I have my mind and will power back. I will say, try something else for anxiety. Gym, meditation, etc. Lexapro sucks and will never ever go on it or any other depression or anxiety drug again. Lexapro turned me into an alcohol dependant person, coming off made me sober. No AA, no books, just plain get off.
There was just absolutely 0 effect, I wouldn’t be in any way surprised if it’s just a placebo drug

Hello! I have been on escitalipram for 4 months for anxiety disorder with panic attacks. After stressful breakdown and some added stress at work plus pandemic and being sick with Covid, I could not recognize myself, I had daily panic attacks and constant anxiety so I could not take care of myself, my family and work. At some point doctor put me on a dose of 10 mg and after two weeks I began to slowly feel like my old self again. I had some side effects during first days, headache, increased anxiety and loss of appetite. But it went away and it was small price to pay. After 3 weeks I was able to get back to work, my energy levels got better and mood was stable and calm and optimistic. I added therapy and physical activity, I feel like I live my life now. This medication is amazing, I am grateful to people who worked on it and made it available for patients in need.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am grateful for those who have posted on this site, as it was so helpful to read your comments.I began taking Lexapro 7 days ago for anxiety.  For years I have had feelings of anxiety, racing pulse, fight or flight feeling,  palpitations, adrenaline with some depression. My dr started me out on 5 mg, and I believe that is the right dose for me.  By day 3, I actually started feeling a bit better.  This does give me some dry mouth, but I have no trouble sleeping.  I feel slightly off or different but does not hamper me in any way.  My evening glass of wine tastes different.  By day 7, today, I dealt with some dating / relationship issues and pandemic dread and instead of it being as debilitating as it could have been in the past, I felt a lot calmer.  I'm feeling SO MUCH BETTER.  Of course we must do the internal work, (therapy, changing past habits that do not serve us) but I truly believe this is a miracle drug.  I wish you all the best in your wellness journey!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started taking Lexapro 5 weeks ago and I can't say enough good about it. I was seriously depressed and my anxiety of just going to work, dealing with everyday life, and staying positive was difficult at best. I broke down and went to the doctors, I'm the kinda dude that doesn't go to the doctors unless it's serious! Anyways very few side effects I had a headache for about a week it wasn't bad just kind of annoying. But I felt that this side effect was manageable, after 5 weeks I am seriously affected positively, my life has changed much, no more bad feelings, no more fear, no more panic attack feelings, no more tight chest, I feel more confident with where life is going, and I owe it all to Lexapro and support from my family! Don't give up, I almost did and So glad I didn't, I have way more positive outlook on my life now!

I have been having anxiety attacks for the last 9 months, crying a lot, the doctor put me on escitaloprám for 16 days, I m feeling dreadful, sweating lots, feel more anxious and fear and depressed. The GP is saying to stick with it, not sure if I can, has anyone any advice?

Lexapro (escitalopram):After one thing after another just going wrong in life I finally had a breakdown where my anxiety caused me to not be able to eat or function. I went to see a counsellor who recommended I ask my GP about going on an antidepressant. I was given Lexapro which I then googled and found all these reviews. I am not going to lie, the first 2-3 weeks are the hardest but I am on week 5 and OMG do I feel great about life and myself!! This drug has given me such an uplift and I can feel my emotions are leveled out!! Things that would stick with me and bring on my anxiety no longer stick with me. I feel the emotion but it subsided and I can move on in my day. I am so so happy to have found this drug! I finally feel like I know what it’s like to live a normal life. If you’ve just started and you feel those off and yucky irritations, please stick with it! There is light at the end of the tunnel and I tell you it’s the best you will ever feel :)
Lexapro (escitalopram):Worked very well just a lil difficult to get off when I tried to wean off but overall I loved it. And will actually go back on if I need to.

Lexapro (escitalopram):The last 12 months my anxiety has got steadily worse. That feeling of being on edge, racing heart, dizziness, brain fog and social anxiety. I had been to the Dr a few times over the last 12 months but when I got to the appointment I always played it down, two weeks ago I was put on 10mg starting off with a gradual dose. I am reviewing early as is if like me you read the reviews most will say you have to cope with a hard few weeks, this was not the case for me. I started to feel a difference on day 3. I have had mild side effects, disturbed sleep/dry mouth but nothing major. For the first time in ages I have felt my shoulders drop, my brain fog start to clear and have enjoyed a couple of social interactions. I only wish I had started this medication sooner. For anyone living with anxiety and starting on this medication, I wish you the same results or better that I have experienced. Thank you to everyone for sharing their experiences, it gave me hope and hope is a medicine in itself.

Lexapro (escitalopram):After 6-8 weeks I could feel my anxiety improving , but I was dumb from from every other emotion. Anxiety was replaced with lack of any emotion, feeling like a zombie, disinterest in progressing in life,  0 sex drive.

Lexapro (escitalopram):MIRACLE DRUG. I’ve been on Lexapro twice now. Once when I was 17. I was Agoraphobic, Depressed and hallucinating when going outside from stress. I have to say, the first 3 days of taking 10mg were AWFUL. Intense nausea, sleeplessness, some of the worst anxiety I had ever had. But after that I started to feel…normal! I was reconnecting with friends, I was seeing the sun, going to parties, being a normal teen! It took about 6 weeks to feel the full effects. I’m now 22, just had my first baby and back on it again from a traumatic pregnancy and birth, I’m on day 2, and feeling like absolute rubbish, but knowing that I will be myself again soon. STICK IT OUT. SCREENSHOT THIS REVIEW TO REMIND YOURSELF THAT THIS NAUSEA AND TIREDNESS WILL END! You got this!

I started this drug a few days ago, the first time I took it I experienced a sort of high. Dilated pupils and overall happiness but that quickly went down hill. I then experienced trembling, nausea, photosensitivity, massive headaches, stomach pain, body aches, dizziness and an overall feeling of dread. My anxiety got so bad to the point I had convinced myself the antidepressants were going to be the end of me. I experienced 5 panic attacks that day and ended up in the ER. This drug was obviously not a good fit for me so I have ceased it but I am still having life impacting panic attacks and anxiety since. This is only my experience with it so please don’t let it deter you, there will always be side effects with medicine so make sure you know what you’re in for.

I have been taking this medication for anxiety for the past 3 months. It has worked well and had minimal side effects. I take it at night, so I find it a little harder to wake up in the morning, I also find my memory is a bit hazier but aside from that 0 side effects. Overall in my experience, it works quite well for anxiety.

Lexapro (escitalopram):This medication has changed my life for the better.I’ve alway struggled with anxiety and depression. Recently I’ve had Major panic attacks. My GP gave me Lexapro. I started on 10mg tab. I got no sleep and felt horrible so I stopped taking it. I did research and people were saying that it usually takes a month or so to start working. And it can make symptoms worse in the meantime. This really scared me. But after talking with some other people that use it I decided to give it another go. But this time I started on half a tablet (5mg). I could sleep thankfully. It did give me strange feelings for the first week. Not that my condition got worse, but I just felt a little off. After a week I started to slowly notice that the depression and anxiety was starting to lift. I upped my dose to 7mg .Within week 3 there was an amazing shift. I feel amazing! It’s the best I’ve felt in my whole life. I’m able to sleep properly and manage my thoughts a lot better. Staying at 7mg

Lexapro (escitalopram):Anyone going through the reviews please understand that this medication takes 6 to weeks before you get any sort of relief . I started having very bad panic attacks , I was waking up at 3 in the morning having a full on anxiety attack and it would go on all day long , I couldn't go back to sleep or eat or function,  tried to be strong and deal with it at home for 3 months and I just couldn't do it anymore so I signed myself into the acute unit .I was bawling, I honestly felt I was never gonna get better that I was better off dead cos the panic and anxiety would not stop ,if it wasn't for my kids or my partner I wouldn't be here. I started on lexapro and olanzapine about 8 weeks ago now, you do get worse before you get better and the last few days I've actually slept and being able to eat and even have coffee, shower and took the kids on a day out. Please don't give up , it takes time.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am a basket case. I have insterstitial cystitis that seems to be aggravated by anxiety, so my doctor put me on 10 mg of Lexapro 11 days ago. I have been in a living nightmare. Two nights with no sleep at all, the only way I can sleep is with a sedative, and even that isn’t enough hours. Nausea, dry mouth, diarrhea, shakiness, increased anxiety. I have a really important trip in six days and am terrified that I will still be ill, but feel like it’s too late to try getting off it. Wish I had never heard of this drug. Am reading so many reviews and it seems like my side effects are worse than most so I have little hope of getting better any time soon.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Day one .Good day, I am a 41-year-old black female married, with children. I mentioned my race because culturally my people will not seek help as it's a stigma that you are weak. I made a major move from Michigan to Fort Lauderdale leaving behind everything I knew including my daughters for a few months. It triggered the panic attacks I again suffered.  I started to self-medicate with marijuana which honestly worked miracles for me up until recently.  I'm starting to feel that weed is causing me more anxiety. Two weeks ago I blacked out and had two major attacks from excessive smoking. These last few attacks landed me in the ER twice in two days.  Over the last few weeks after that I have not been the same, my anxiety was now being aided with mild depression.  I finally sought help from my psychiatrist and now I have a therapist as well. This is my first day on Lexapro am dose. I had to go home for lunch and take a nap I couldn't keep my eyes open. I don't think it's Lexapro alone.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have suffered from anxiety and depression since I was 19 (now 38) and this past pandemic year my anxiety, stress levels and depression just shot up. I was having to double my dose of hydroxyzine to go get groceries or even make an appointment.  I work, I am a student, and a single mom of three kids. The past 2 months I was running on maybe 2 hours of sleep and just out of it. I started Lexapro recently (I am on day 4). My doctor prescribed me 5 mg and advised me to take it before bed. My first 2 days I did feel a little "tired" and napped on and off. Day 3 and 4, and I am noticing I have slept through the night and woken up refreshed. This is very new to me. Yesterday I made it through the day without a nap!! I am excited to see where this takes me. Hang in there. I will be back to review in a few weeks.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was very hopeful about this, taking it for severe anxiety and agoraphobia. But I am quitting after 3 weeks of taking the bare minimum amount. This was a mental and physical torture, that I wish I never had to experience. I tried to push through,  but it's just unbearable, even with daily xanax. I had side effects from Lexapro  including horrible constant nausea, shivers, terrible GERD/gut issues, genital numbness, insomnia, memory problems, panic attacks, suicidal thoughts. The more bizarre ones are sweating a lot, bad body odor, ear ringing, muscle twitches, jittery hands. Mind you: I am a young woman, with no medical condition. And only a couple of mgs of this medication left me with terrific physical problems, and I'm just hoping they will heal with time. I felt a little ease in my anxiety at the beginning, but I'm pretty sure that was just the brain fog numbing my ability to think anxiously (and to think at all). I didn't feel like myself. Horrible side effects even on a quarter of a dose, it's honestly horrifying.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I related to the word anxiety the same way a fish would relate to water. At 41, I just called this way of having an up and down mood with an internal buzzing normal. But I was making my life smaller and smaller. I was able to handle less. All Relationships  were falling apart and the ability to keep a job getting even spottier.Now, I feel like a well balanced person with patience, focus and capable. I can reason through situations and without breaking down. I feel mentally tough and yet at peace. I worked a 13 hour day, and felt like my brain was in it’s own bubble bath. Not euphoric. Just inner calm and capable.I’m on 5 mg. 10mg was too much and dipped my mood.I have some insomnia and started with diarrhea. But no irritation around the insomnia.Both are getting better.And I don't need to start my day with adderall unless I need a boosted focus. Future is looking bright
Felt a bit better. Today feeling worse than ever. Thanks

I am finally breathing and feel alive due to this wonderful drug. It is difficult for the first few weeks but it gets soo much better overtime.I started having sudden panic attacks anytime of day or in deep sleep almost everyday or I'd say more than once a day, every part of my body was feeling off balance even my eyes it felt so bad that I cannot imagine anything worse even exists in the universe.Thanks to my doc and family support I am back to 100% normal. I never though I was getting myself back ever.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Hello, just looking for some support. Started on 5mg April 20, didn’t have too many side effects compared to the anxiety symptoms.  Still emotional in the morning, wobbly legs, internal shaking, brain zaps, lack of concentration. Finally I was starting to smile and able to handle the other effects, last week I increased to 10mg and bang, I feel horrible. Crying every morning, waking up 5am everyday. Internal shaking, head feels funny, heart racing. Please tell me this will pass. I’m 4 weeks on it. Stated at 5mg now 10mg. I want to stay on it but feel terrible.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I'm on day two of taking Lexapro. After starting College remotely full time for nursing and finishing up my first semester, one night out of nowhere I had my first anxiety attack since childhood. The attacks intensified, I was constantly anxious, convinced I was deathly ill, afraid to be around anyone but my husband. I felt like my personality had been ripped away. After about two week of not being able to get it under control I set up an appointment with my doctor and was put on Lexapro. I'm only two days in but so far it has helped, I still feel anxious at times but I'm able to calm myself down. I still don't feel quite like myself but I figure it will come in time. A few things I've noticed since taking the medication are, dry mouth, sluggishness, a bit foggy at times, still a little anxious but it's manageable, and a bit dizzy. My appetite has started to come back but stomach is still a little off. I will update at my 1 month mark, hang in there everyone we will overcome.

Part 2/2. As promised this is part 2. A few weeks after I wrote my first review I still experienced some anxiety but it started getting easier to manage. This stuff works. I was very doubtful but just be patient and it will kick in. However, I am upping my dose to 15mg because I still need just a little extra. But I know this stuff works and 15mg will help me feel even better. Give it time and do what is right for you. I am very glad I started taking this medicine.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Day 3 on Lexapro. Had been on it a few years ago and it worked great. I have severe anxiety, intrusive thoughts and panic attacks. Got side effects the first time I used it and was started at 5mg. I think some of that was fear of a new medication. This time was started on 10mg. Except for being tired about an hour after taking it (which is why I take it after dinner) I haven’t had any other side effects. Slept great. Woke up feeling better just knowing relief is coming.  I usually wait months trying to cure my anxiety naturally which sadly I haven’t been able to. I suffer for months, finally take the med & then regret waiting. Gave in much faster this time. Life should be more than nonstop worrying. I’ll post an update in a few weeks.

Had been suffering from anxiety/depression for six months or so before talking things over with my doc. I am a 76 year old male. The terms anxiety and depression are a bit blurred in my mind. I was feeling dismal and had a vague feeling that something awful was going to happen, in spite of logically knowing that there was no reason for feeling that way. I could not shake it. Went on 5 mg of Lexapro 30 days ago. I had  the full gamut of side effects. Intense exhaustion and a  dizzy feeling were the worst;  very bad for about two weeks and it was only after four weeks that the side effects have abated. Taking the dose near bedtime helped. Perhaps for many, the side effects may last a couple of weeks, don’t throw in the towel if they last longer. We are all different. After a month I am starting to see the light at the end of the tunnel. Side effects have faded and some improvements in the depression, and expect continued improvement.

I am so thankful for this medication. I was having terrible anxiety/panic attacks and severe insomnia. My doctor prescribed me Cipralex. I do NOT like pharmaceutical meds, but because I was in a very bad way I tried it. I started with 10mg and it helped a very tiny bit, so my doctor then suggested to go up to 20mg. It took 4 weeks but I have now been sleeping through the ENTIRE night for the last 3 weeks!!! That alone helps the anxiety. I am cool, calm and collected. I have not had any weight gain.  I started taking 10mg on January 28th. March 11 up to 20mg. It’s now April 26 and my husband is beyond happy to have his wife back. Give it time. I have energy and I laugh again. #Thankful

Lexapro (escitalopram):Work anxiety was making my life so miserable before taking Lexapro. My quality of life, and enjoyment of my work, improved dramatically a few weeks after starting Lexapro. I do not plan to stop taking this drug.

I have experienced anxiety/depression for most of my adult life. It began when I was in my mid twenties and would gradually subside & then could reappear sometimes years later. My mother & grandmother both had the same problems, I believe. I am now an 80 year old male. Several years ago I had an event which set off a new bout of anxiety/depression & I could just not shake it. I tried therapy & that helped for a while but then I would go back to increased anxiety. I had resisted antidepressants as I thought I could just handle it-- I was wrong. In retrospect I wish I had started on Lexapro earlier. The first two weeks were difficult but by the end of week 3 things began to improve and now after 5 weeks my anxiety/depression has almost disappeared & I feel like myself again. It has been a miracle. So if you are struggling I would say hang in there & give it time.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on just 2.5mg Lexapro for 7 weeks. I was terrified to go on this medication because I’m so sensitive to side effects. I went on it for panic attacks and an off-balance feeling that my doctor says it’s caused by anxiety! I have these feelings from the minute I open my eyes till the minute I go to bed at night. After four days of starting the medication I began having terrible side effects.  I was more off-balance than before, dizzy and a little nauseous my anxiety was so bad I was getting so scared that it was not going to work for me.  At four weeks I started having some good days in between the bad days. I just went to see my doctor again and he wants me to go up to 5 MG as that is more of a therapeutic dose. I started it for three days now , and getting the same start up side effects again. I guess I just have to give it time to work . I’ve had heard great things about it and hope it works for me. I just want my life back.
Lexapro (escitalopram):After a week on Lexapro, it made me have an irregular heart beat and I had to see the cardiologist to tell me that it was a possible side effect.

I'm on Cipralex (aka. Lexapro in Europe) for already two weeks. To be frank - my anxiety has increased and all day I experience that fight or flight feeling inside, that is really not easy to push away while thinking. But all the good feedback on here keeps me optimistic and I hope all this will turn into out good after all - keep you posted. But first two weeks are not for me, really.... :(

How can a drug that causes such horrific side effects possibly be good for your body?! I took 10 mg for three days. The side effects were so awful-nausea, dizziness, exhaustion by day, insomnia at night, terrible overall feeling. I quit after the third day and am feeling normal again.

DO NOT TAKE THIS DRUG AT NIGHT!!!! The heart palpitations start a couple hours after taking it followed by insomnia. And I was only on 5mg. This drug may be good for depression but NOT for anxiety disorder.

Review (1/2) hello all, as you can see this is the first half of my review. I'm on 10mg and I am just over 3 1/2 weeks on escitalopram. I want to share what I've felt/feel before the drug really kicks in. I have had anxiety my whole life but it wasn't nearly as bad as it has been recently. These past few years though it has gotten increasingly worse. Last month was the worst it's ever been. I dropped 3 of my 4 classes, stopped going to the gym, and even stopped working for a couple weeks. I was having panic attacks daily. I decided I needed to take a step in the right direction. So, I started taking this medication. The first week for me was awful, side effects were rough and even increased anxiety. Week 2 was better and week 3 feels decent. It has gotten better though and I believe it will get better. The medication hasn't even really "kicked in" so I'm staying optimistic. I will update in a few weeks once it does. Stay positive and take care of yourselves!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I just started escitalopram 10mg a week ago. I suffer from severe panic and have horrible balance issues. My anxiety starts from the time I wake up til my head hits the pillow. Balance issues make me nauseous so I can’t eat. Lost weight which I really can’t afford. I’ve been experiencing hot burning sensations in my back and arms at night, wake up soaking wet or sweaty, finger tips get numb, dry mouth, shaky and my heart rate has dropped to the low 60’s at night. Reading all these reviews has encouraged me to stick it out and hope for better results. First time on SSRI medication. Seem to be off balance more than before. Hope this subsides.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have suffered from extreme anxiety for years now. I would awake at 3:00 am every morning gripped with thrashing unreasonable thoughts that led into a panic. I stayed disoriented, dizzy, glassy-eyed, heart-pounding, crying myself to sleep at night wanting to be "normal" again. The first week of taking 5 mg. of Lexapro, everything got worse,  I was more anxious and very tired. 2 Weeks into taking Lexapro, the darkness began to lift! I was finally coming alive. I was feeling much better than I had been in years. After 2 months on 5 mg, I increased to 10 mg. The initial side effects returned and my anxiety and tiredness came back. I fought through the first week. WOW!The outcome is more than I could have hoped for! I am calm, happy, laughing, silly, and ever so grateful! I would encourage you to try Lexapro and be prepared for a possible adjustment stage, but after the storm, oh what beauty!Be good to yourself fight for your happy place. God Bless you on your journey.

I just started this med  3 days ago for daily panic attacks with all those terrifying symptoms. I would like to thank to you all for encouragement and positive review . It helps me a lot  and for next weeks I will be back to keep reading your shared experiences to help me keep going  and gives me hope for better days

Lexapro (escitalopram):Hi there. This is my 1 year update. I started on 2.5 and went up to 5. Let me just tell you this. I got my life back. I was in a point in my life where my brain chemicals reworked themselves into being in CONSTANT flight or fight mode; even when NOTHING was wrong. I couldn’t go into a grocery store without fearing a panic attack. Fast forward one year later - I have traveled on a plane [was my biggest fear] alone and HAPPY. Let me say that I do have a therapist. I eat healthy. Work out 2-3 times and have a good support system. It’s not a magic pill but it does help your chemicals in your brain. I have read the same scary reviews you have. I have overthought myself to death. Trust in the process. You will be okay. (Not a doctor. Personal experience)

Lexapro (escitalopram):After trying Buspar for anxiety and chronic dizziness and not having much (if any) improvement I spoke to my doctor about trying an SSRI. He recommended Lexapro. He said it is well tolerated with fewer side effects. For the record I am 59 years old and never taken any medication like this. Having found myself suddenly with increasing chronic dizziness (6 months), balance issues, anxiety, increasing sense of panic. I had to try something. My life had become miserable. Deciding to try an SSRI, in my case Lexapro, was a game changer. While all my symptoms didn’t disappear I can now manage my day easily. I rarely feel a sense of panic, my dizziness has improved by about 90%, I can now resume daily walking of 3 miles, and rarely cry. When I do begin to think about worrisome thoughts I find I can’t focus on them for long. I just forget about it! My negative side effects are minimal. Dry mouth, occasional increased sweating, some odd dreams, lack of orgasm.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Please read my comment. If you have ever had a drug-induced seizure from a medication in the past, do NOT take this medication. If you have cortical dysplasia, do NOT take this drug. I have cortical dysplasia and my doc wouldn’t prescribe a benzodiazepine. I took the smallest dose for three days. On the third day, I had a 45 minute seizure and suffered from hypoxia. Ever since then 2 years ago, I have constant seizures now and have extremely bad paranoia and anxiety, especially when trying new medications. Now I’m on 5 different benzos plus Z-drugs and muscle relaxants due to this drug. It literally ruined my life in three days.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I must admit I always thought people with anxiety just needed to suck it up. I was wrong. I had a happy life but would become so overwhelmed by small things like having a birthday party for my daughter. My heart would race. I would be irritable. I have now been on this for over a year and love it. I feel happier and more able to deal with stress. The first week I felt terrible but it's worth it.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started having major panic and anxiety, intrusive thoughts (OCD) flair up over a year ago. I was put on prozac which I took for 6 weeks which really messed with my head. I was scared of medication after that. I have been on ativan daily for over a year. Which I really don't want to be on. But nothing seemed to help because I was too scared of taking  antidepressants. So I was put on a mood stabalizer Lamictal, but we decided I needed to try something else. I have been on lexapro for 3 weeks I did get nausea, loss appetite and felt lazy. Which honesty I didn't mind because I'm always OCD cleaning. I envied people who could sit and do nothing. The nausea has gone away. I have only taken 1/2 ativan every other day. And hoping soon to come off that fully. And that right there that means so much to me. This pill works. It has helped me so much. I'm so happy I tried it. Not all medications are the same, some can trigger bad things. I'm happy with my doctors who are there for me and therapy has helped tons!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Had to stop Lexapro. The first two weeks were rough, third and fourth week my anxiety/OCD symptoms alleviated but on the 5th week I had immense panic attacks and anxiety for almost two weeks before levelling off. I wanted to push myself to see how far I can go. By 2 months, my OCD intrusive thoughts became much more reoccurring and frequent, and I was getting very disturbing thoughts which I never had before really. I had to quit because although it did kind of alleviate anxiety, it gave me more obsessions and intrusive thoughts that I’ve never experienced before. TLDR, first three weeks were fine, the rest up until 2.5 months have not worked and have had anxiety spikes and worse intrusive thoughts

I have been suffering from anxiety, depression panic attacks all my life and thought this is the normal way of living. The past three years I was living in constant deep depression and anxiety attacks. I lost interest in life, PTSD effects were so real and I was against meds.  I reached to a point that I was suicidal but having a daughter kept me going. Then one day I decided to change my mind and try antidepressants.  The doctor prescribed cipralix . The first two weeks were awful I know, but then it started to get better slowly, I am on 20 mg now and this is my 9th week and I feel alive and happy again. I have so much in me that I want share with the world.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Hi everyone,I have had anxiety my whole life panic attacks and everything. Anxiety runs in my family as well. I have been on Lexapro for ~2/3 weeks now and WOW. I had NO IDEA my life could feel this good. I was to totally unaware about how much my anxiety was controlling my life and how it was causing my physical pain. I am only on 5mg and it has been amazing. I had a headache for about a week, 1 day of nausea and a little bit of shakiness. It wasn’t anything that kept me home from work and I would take some Advil for the headache and it would subside. I was always one of those people who would never take pills I regularly exercise and eat healthy and finally decided to get help and I am SO GLAD I did. Definitely don’t be afraid to try Lexapro it could change your life!!!!!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started out on Zoloft and the side effects were horrible, I couldn't even get out of bed. I went to Lexapro and the only side effects I've had so far are strange dreams. I also take hydroxyzine and propranolol. I'm able to wake up normally and my anxiety has gone down. I can't believe how crippling my anxiety was until I started this medication. I never wanted to do anything I just stayed in bed all day I couldn't even look at my phone. I can finally get up and do things. I still have bad days but I have days where I feel happy now and can actually get up.

This is my 4th day on Escitalopramunlike prozac which started its side effects right away the med has given me no side effects other than calm. I have had trauma induced PTSD which I haven't had since taking it.

Last year I went through an extremely stressful period in my marriage, experiencing intense anxiety every day (a persistent state of bodily terror). I could hardly sleep, struggled to eat & lost almost a stone. I was very close to a complete nervous breakdown. My GP initially tried Sertraline. This helped about 50%, but I still wasn’t okay, even at 200mg. I then  switched to Escitalopram. I had a hard time during the switch (increased anxiety, low mood, suicidal thoughts) but within a couple of weeks it was definitely working. I started on 10mg, increased to 15mg (similar increase in anxiety etc initially) now up to 20mg. I feel 95% myself again, consistently. Even though I was having therapy & support from friends & family, I don’t feel I could have recovered without this medication. My only ongoing side-effect is decreased sex drive & delayed orgasm, but I am hoping I will not be on this medication forever & that these will then normalise.

I was only able to take it for 2 days. The side effects where horrible and I am currently on my back recovering from diviculitis. While I was on the drug my stomach would burn as if on fire, my knees would hurt and I felt foggy. The stomach burn was the one that made me quit the drug. This generic stuff is just horrible. I was on lexapro in 2005 and it was the best antidepressant drug for me. Unfortunately lexapro will now cost $400!

Lexapro (escitalopram):No effect besides negative side effects. No sex drive. No interest in sex. Hard to focus. My heart rating plummeted. When I stopped, it went back up. Someone at law school was touting Lexapro. For me it does nothing. It doesn't fix the reality of this corrupt society. Makes you sleepy too. Dry mouth.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I was on Lexapro for a little under a year and it didn’t help whatsoever with my anxiety. It didn’t necessarily make it worse but it didn’t help either. I started on the lowest dose and then went up and on the second highest dose I turned into a rage monster. This one wasn’t for me.

Escitalopram has been great to me. Was started on 5 mg dose escitalopram by Cipla from Walgreens and it was amazing after 2-3 weeks adjustment . Then later started on escitalopram from Lupin from CVS and it was great for anxiety but I had delayed ejaculation as a side effect which got better over time . Then I went to Randall’s in Houston which is an Albertsons subsidiary with GoodRx coupon which was 8$ for 90 days compared to 40$ from CVS and Walgreens and got escitalopram 5 mg distributed bySolco Healthcare and manufactured overseas . After one month I started have severe anxiety and migraines Again like pre Escitalopram that lasted 2 weeks till I decided to switch to the one from CVS Lupin manufacturer and the anxiety and migraines improved drastically. Please be aware of the Escitalopram from Solco Healthcare . It’s a round white pill P5. Don’t use it Please and be careful of cheap generics from now on .

I have been on escitalopram for 4 years and after awhile I had to be put on lorazepam  2 mg         3 times a day . IT does nothing for my anxiety contrary to what is suppose to do. Now I am addicted to it. I am about 80%  helped with this pill which  I take 30 mg in the morning. Is there anyone that has a similar experience . My Dr said I can’t help you , I tried everything.         Major side effect in my extreme anxiety.
I did not care for the flat emotion.  I am not a robot.

Thank you to everyone who says to ‘hang in there’, when I feel anxious I come on here and read positive reviews to get me through. I have always been a little bit of an anxious person but big shock with a family member tipped me over the edge. Tremors hit me so bad. I wake up and as soon as I open my eyes my body shakes and I lay in the fetal position. I didn’t start escitalopram straight away, thought I could get better on my own, silly me.  I have now started medication, 5mg for 4 days then 10mg. I am now on day 13 and boy has it been rough. I now know what people mean when they say the first couple of weeks are super bad. Side effects are horrible with restless, dizziness and fatigue. I just want my life back. I will hang on for dear life and report back in a few days. Thanks again for the positive reviews. I wish there was a chat line where ppl could text each other. Just wanted to touch base and thank everyone  as I don’t feel so alone when I read reviews. Love to all

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro has been literally life-changing. I didn’t realize how bad my anxiety was until it was gone, but WOW what a difference. I was paralyzed with anxiety, had panic attacks regularly, etc, and now that I don’t, it blows my mind that I used to live like that. I’ve always been against meds of any kind and had tried every supplement I could research, but nothing ever worked like lexapro has. (Only take 10mg and have had no side effects.)
Before taking escitalopram I had explosive and violent reactions but after use escitalopram 5mg I can control my stupid violent reactions. Nowadays I am a new human being, I used it for 3 months.

I have a general social anxiety disorder. My doctor prescribed me escitalopram 10mg and I used it for a couple of months. It didn't fully treat my anxiety but it decreased the symptoms a bit. My doctor then prescribed me with 20mg dosage of those tablets. Now after two weeks I feel more stressed and I am sleepy and out of energy most of the times. Why isn't there a right medication for this bloody anxiety?

I was on Etalopro  for few months for the first time (it was for asthma that was anxiety related), before I tried Xanax. Both meds worked really well for me.Etalopro I will say it's really an amazing med for your mood, concentration, sharpens memory, no emotions for stupid things, I am off this med for few days feeling withdrawal  such as light headaches, dizziness, but all only light symptoms. I would  absolutely  recommend  them for anyone suffering from depression, anxiety or other diseases.

I started out with 10 mg of Lexapro and then switched to 20 mg after a month of not really feeling a difference in my anxiety levels. I've been on the 20 mg for about two weeks and I don't feel like my anxiety has increased or decreased and I've had pretty low energy. I'm tired from pretty much the moment I wake up to when I go to sleep and then I have a lot of trouble falling to sleep. My libido has definitely decreased as well, and actually reaching orgasm is super difficult. Hopefully, I'll be switching meds soon :(

I have been prescribed escitalopram for anxiety and panic attacks. I started to have panic attacks out of nowhere, sometimes even 3 and more panic attacks a day, or I could wake up with panic attacks in the middle of the night lasting anywhere from 20 minutes to 3 hours. I couldn't sleep, couldn't eat and was anxious - also important to mention that I have MS and all this started when I switched from Copaxone to Ocrevus. Finally, I was prescribed with Escitalopram. I was supposed to take it before sleep, however first days I got so anxious from taking it, that I couldn't fall asleep almost until morning. So after 3 days, I switched and took it in the morning - took 5 mg first week and since then I am taking 10 mg. The first week my condition worsen - almost couldn't sleep at all, lost a lot of weight and had some night panic attacks but after like 10 days I felt so much better - no more panic attacks and my sleep improved so much!! Only downside is fatigue, other than that I feel great.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Omg Lexapro has seriously saved my life. I had tried Effexor before it, and the side effects were so bad that I had a mini seizure. I was so afraid to try another drug that I almost didn't take the Lexapro. I'm so glad I did though. I have never felt this free of anxiety. I used to get literally paralyzing panic attacks and endless days of crying over anxiety sparked by freakin' nothing. I can live my life now and I feel so inspired to be creative again. I will never go back. Don't get me wrong I still have anxiety at times, but it doesn't just sit all day with me or trigger depression anymore.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I started taking Lexapro after 5 weeks on Prozac wasn’t working for me. On Prozac I felt completely numb and my emotions were blunted and causing me to spiral into depression.  I could feel the effect of switching to Lexapro almost immediately.  My anxiety has decreased substantially, no panic attacks, and I’m able to feel pleasure and joy again.  The only side effect I’ve had is moderate drowsiness so I take it at night.  I am so relieved that I stuck with it and had the courage to switch to a different SSRI. For any of you that are feeling discouraged,  stay the course and find what works for you. This med was a lifesaver for me.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have OCD intrusive thoughts. I have so much anxiety that I can’t sleep.  Sometimes I’ll be up for hours and only sleep 1-3 hours a night. My anxiety will feel like death, I literally feel like someone is going to hurt me and death is near. My chest will hurt, I can’t think and my hands tingle. I can barely function and I have a family and work full time.Pros: After taking Lexapro, I have not had any anxiety, I am able to sleep at night. And I don’t even have a lot of intrusive thoughts. If I do, I’m able to think clearly. And I don’t perform compulsions either. I went from a high 20 level of anxiety to about a 1-2. It works for me!Cons: the downside is that it will mess with your sexual drive, or inability to orgasm. I’m happily married so this is awful. I’m hoping this is temporary, and I wished there were other side effects. But I’m not sure how long I’ll be on this medication due to this side effect.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Today my 4th day on this med my doctor started me on 10 mg dose. The side effects have been horrible: headaches, nausea, the worst side effect is that I literally can't get out of bed and I haven't been to work in 4 days. Doctor told me to cut the 10mg tablet in half start taking it at night because my body is getting used to the serotonin, I can't sleep and it has been like this for a couple of days.  I haven't gotten anxiety but have gotten panic attacks very little. I will update

Lexapro (escitalopram):Hey Gang, I suffered from DP/DR and depression because of it. It nearly was the last straw for me last year in 2020, but I read these reviews and it gave me hope. I took a gene test, learned that I needed to supplement with Deplin due to MTFHR gene. I paired 5MG of lexapro w/ .5mg Rexulti and my life changed. I had zero sexual side effects which was a major concern for me and most of all, I'm doing the things I love again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on Lexapro 6 weeks now 5mg. I have been suffering with anxiety for years and finally decided to talk to my doctor about it.  I wish I started it sooner!!! It has been a life changer.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I thought I could cope without antidepressants & wasted many years of my life struggling with stress & anxiety. After an extremely stressful event I eventually 'crashed' & could no longer function. I couldn't eat, had terrible restlessness, I felt like I was detached from everyone & everything, I couldn't focus, I was confused, not sleeping at all most nights & depression hit hard. I had no choice but to begin medication immediately. The initial side effects of Cipralex wore off after about 2 weeks. My appetite returned, I began sleeping again & I felt calm. The side effects were minimal & were a small price to pay for the benefits of the medication. I was on 10mg for 14 months & tapered off gradually over 4 months. I had discontinuation symptoms of anxiety & insomnia for a few days but it's now been 2 weeks since stopping completely & I'm feeling great!

Lexapro (escitalopram):An anti-depressant that makes you horny. First I would like to say that I have tried every anti-depressant know to man or woman!!! My last Script was celexa it was ok but coming off that stuff made me want till stab everyone and sex was close to non existent. Now here is the good part! Doc tried me on lexapro no noticeable change after day 1, Day 2 I felt really calm but day 3 Wow!!!! All I could think about was sex! I was so wet. I have really bad anxiety and lexapro is orgasmic bliss!!! Thanks Doc. Leslie From South Carolina

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro changed my life for sure!  My family has a history of anxiety so it was not a surprise when I started having severe anxiety and panic attacks. That warm, flush, buzzing feeling that overtakes your body and your mind immediately thinks you’re going to die or that you're sick. Your heart is racing and feels like it’s going to jump out of your chest and your head is spinning.  It’s a feeling I don’t wish on anyone and it was starting to control my life. Once I started lexapro I almost immediately noticed positive results. It took about 6 weeks to really notice significant changes and about a year before I would say I was 100% myself. But it very quickly made my life manageable and now I can’t imagine my life without it!  I still get breakthroughs now and then where I get a bout of anxiety but it’s usually short lived and manageable. If you have just started lexapro hang in there!

Lexapro (escitalopram):On lexapro for about 7 days now and boy I have mixed feelings so far. The first 3 days my anxiety was minimal. I felt good but on day 4 it all changed. Severe heart palpitations to where I had to call 911 thinking that my number  was called. Not sure if I should stop this med or continue so I opted for the latter. I'm giving it a couple more weeks hopefully it kicks in if not I'll try something else.

I have been on (escitalopram) 5mg from 2 days. I didn't feel much in the way of side effects. So I am feeling ol, just getting little more anxious thoughts and mood swings. Rest all ok. I will share my journey again after few days. But it is a first for me being on anxiety medication.  I am hoping to feel better and back again soon. Lots of love to all who are struggling. You are not alone. We all are in this together..hugs..!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Currently 10 days into my second time on Lexapro. I’ve been on 10 mg since 2013 for Chronic anxiety. Last year I started to taper off on my own and I pushed it too far. A severe breakdown over the holidays showed me that I’m more myself with my medication. Oh boy the first week was horrible. I would read these reviews for encouragement in my darkest moments. Go for walks, talk with your loved ones, allow yourself to lay low and give the medication a chance to work. My appetite is still missing and I’m still have racing/disturbing thoughts but I feel better each day! My insomnia has subsided and the muscle twitches. Lexapro has saved my life once before and I know it will again. If you’re reading this- hang in there, you’re not alone in this struggle. You can do hard things!

Day 1 of 5mg Escitalopram.  Took before bed.  I woke up 3 times and got a total of 6 hours of interrupted sleep.  I’m anxious.  I haven’t felt the effects of anxiety like this in at least 5 years.  Xanax worked just fine for me but now I’m told there is no option to continue with what has worked for longer than 6 weeks.  I’m experiencing low energy, vertigo type anxiety and a slightly tight chest.  If I had to work, it wouldn’t happen.  I definitely can’t drive.  I hope this changes.  I feel out of control again.  Why is it that doctors don’t just let sleeping dogs lay?

Lexapro (escitalopram):I am a firm believer that everyone has a specific medication that works for their brain chemistry. Lexapro just happens to be my miracle drug! If I could rate it higher than 10 I would. I see that a lot of people have low libido on this medication, but that is not the case with me. My sex drive has actually improved massively when anxiety & depression aren't in the picture. I've been on 10mg Lexapro for 2 years and it has taken the very dark lows out of my life without any side effects. My emotions more controlled, my anxiety is calmer, my life is such much more manageable. Only con to lexapro is night sweats & brain zaps (only if I forget a dose - if I don't forget a dose, that doesn't happen). Other than that, I cannot recommend Lexapro enough. It has improved my life tenfold & given my happiness back. Lexapro doesn't make you feel like a zombie; I feel more myself than I have my whole life. Take negative reviews with a grain of salt. It could be your miracle drug too.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I have been on Lexapro for 20 days now to treat anxiety and depression.  The first several days, I felt nauseous and zombie - like.  I don’t have those side effects now, but I am unable to get out of bed and can’t wait to lay down again.  I have no desire to do anything and the anxiety seems to have intensified.  I have chest pain and sweat profusely during attacks.  I have to take CBD oil and listen to meditation tapes to make it through the day.  I honestly do not feel any better.  I am taking 5 mg a day - how long does it take to start kicking in?

Lexapro (escitalopram):Was on 10mg Lexapro for about 6 months. Was very effective at reducing anxiety but found it was making me slightly reclusive and reduced my libido. Reduced dose to 5mg found it to be just as effective and with less side effects.

I've been on it for a while. I feel it works well enough for me. I had heart palpitations from anxiety. Started with 10mg and it worked great no side effects other than thirst. 6 months later palpitations came back but anxiety wise I was fine. My doctor upped my dose to 20mg. It worked but I do experience side effects now. Headaches more frequently, when I took it during the day I was in a total fog and was effecting my work so had to switch to taking it at night. But now I have insomnia. I can fall asleep easy enough but I wake up religiously between 2 and 5 am completely wired and unable to go back to sleep. I also have NO appetite with the 20mg. But it's working for my anxiety so I was approved for a medical marijuana card for my PTSD but also the doctor felt it would help balance out the side effects. While the medication works for general uplifted mood and anxiety it doesn't help with "the big sad" so its nice to have marijuana as a back up when that occurs.

First day on escitalopram I couldn't make it off the lounge suite, dozing all day. 2nd day reduced down to 2.5mg and felt better but then today day 3 feel super shaky and mega depressed and nauseous as well as dopey. I would rather deal with recurring thoughts. I don't want and anxiety than feel like this. The end results  isI've flushed the whole packet and will definitely not go down this road again.

Lexapro (escitalopram):The first 3-4 weeks are tough...I knew it would take some time but I felt a bit like a zombie or a sloth those first few weeks. My anxiety fuelled me before and I suddenly had an I don’t care attitude about everything. About week 3, I suddenly felt CLEAR. I was able to do things like go into my laundry room and do one load of laundry without feeling overwhelmed by the other 5 loads that needed to be done. My anxiety was an all or nothing situation- I either could do it all at one time or could NEVER get it done in my brain. Lexapro allowed me to realize that it’s ok to do part of a task and finish it later- and helped me remember to finish it later. I feel so much better!!!

Lexapro (escitalopram):I took this medication Lexapro for almost 2 years for severe anxiety and moderate depression. I started at a 10 mg tablet and about 6 months after I started, my dose was upped to the 20 mg tablet. It made me feel completely exhausted before I started taking a stimulant and overall in the beginning, I felt okay. After about a year of being on this medication, I became very depressed and overly sensitive (when I was never like this in the past) and it made me feel overall more depressed than I had before and slightly suicidal. A little after 2 years of taking this medication, I decided to no longer continue using it and suddenly stopped, cold turkey. There were some withdrawal phases, but overall I felt so much better once I stopped using it. I feel that this medication would probably have been more effective for me if I used it for a short term and not for a duration of more than a year.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Been on 5 mg Lexapro for several months. It was bad at first.  Also use 0.25 Xanax. To help with side effects. Found out about Albizia tinc and pills. Will stop the xanax.  Ashwaghsnda. Holy basil lemon balm are all good so you csn stay on low dose. Rhodiola.  Finally got appetite back. Passion flower will help you sleep.

For a month I was suffering from serious symptoms (shortness of breath, nausea, loss of appetite- palpitation, lightheaded ), after doing all scans and tests (normal) doctors agreed that anxiety is the cause! although I’m a calm person, never had panic or any anxiety related issues  before ! Anyways I was prescribed Cipralex for 3 months and taken my first 5mg pill, few hours later  I had the worst side effects ever, all my existing symptoms became worse plus new unpleasant symptoms like (seeing stuff doesn’t exist, deadly headache, feelings that I cannot describe, like if my soul is suffering, I had numerous panic attacks, I became so depressed and sad for 3 days , couldn’t stop crying, the extreme fatigue kept me in bed, barely can lift an arm. It took the pill effects 3 days to leave my body, worst days in my life..It seems this medicine is not for everyone, it was a lifesaver for my sister.My advice never start a new med on a weekend, and always test it with low dosage.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I can’t say much yet but don’t think I’ll have the chance to since I don’t think this drug is working for me. It’s been almost 2 weeks on 5 mg to treat my GAD and I have experienced on and off burning/tingling  sensations in my limbs, decreased appetite, headache, change in vision, increased anxiety, and the absolute worst panic attacks of my life (felt like I was going to die and lasted over an hour) These side effects are absolutely horrible and I don’t know if I can make it through to see it work. I have never felt worse.

Lexapro (escitalopram):Took this awful med for three months until I could stand it no more. I have regular bouts of anxiety which I kept at bay for 15 years using Ativan carefully as needed. Unfortunately after this time I lost control and had the worst rebound anxiety of my life and had to back out using Valium. I was put on Lexapro to take its place. After 3 months I was battling to get out of bed. If I did it was to the couch. Lost all sex drive and ability. Had no motivation for anything and just laid around all day. Have been off it for a week now and despite some discomfort with head spins I feel I have my life back.

Male, 23 years old, social anxiety. Put on 10mg escitalopram, after 3 weeks increased to 20mg/d. In the beginning I had some trouble falling asleep, increased bowel movements and some nausea. No sexual side effects aside from more frequent erections. Slight decrease in appetite. Mild morning somnolence and rarely a headache. The biggest improvement happened at week 6 of treatment so you gotta be patient and give it time. I feel like I have a lot more energy now, and weirdly my movements feel a lot more precise. But most importantly my anxiety levels are close to non-existent and social interactions are incredibly easy. I feel like my mind is clear and the fog/white noise in the back of my head is gone. I find myself smiling a lot more and just generally being really content with life. I'm still seeing improvements currently at month 2 of treatment, so it really does continually get better and better. I hope this helps others because escitalopram has truly been life-changing for me.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I've been on Lexapro for 6 weeks for severe anxiety with depression. I'm feeling better than I have in years! Finally found something that works for me! Hang in there y'all. It just really started working in the last week.

Lexapro (escitalopram):I’ve been on Lexapro for a year now. Started at 5 mg. in Dec. Of 2019 and felt better, but the real improvement didn’t happen until March 2020 when my Dr. increased my dose to 10 mg. I started medication in the first place because  I got to the dreaded point where I couldn’t drive anymore because of panic attacks, but now I’m driving again and no panic attacks. I still get anxiety, but I’m able to work through it. Lexapro has improved my life so much! I’m one of those people who didn’t want to take medication and tried everything else homeopathic, but in the end, I needed more. It does take patience because it does take weeks to kick in. But other than that, I have no complaints and feel like I have my life back!

Lexapro (escitalopram):Lexapro has been a lifesaver for me. It is the only thing that can quiet my anxiety when it reaches its breaking point and takes over everything in my life. 3 times now I’ve tried to taper off but experienced difficult life circumstances each time that prompted me to go back on it. The difference before and after is unreal. It makes life manageable again

When I was prescribed this medication escitalopram (for panic attacks, agoraphobia and mild depression) I was sceptical, partly because of all the negative and sometimes scary reviews on here. Eventually, I was desperate so I tried it, expecting to suffer the first couple of weeks and have to take time off work and study. Not at all! First 2 weeks (5mg) were fantastic, I did lose my appetite a bit and sometimes feel light-headed but benefits were obvious from the first morning. I finally had energy and smiling didn't feel like a chore. My fatigue and nausea were greatly reduced.Now that I've been on escitalopram for a while (10mg), I have fatigue again however reduced mood swings, anxiety and I can concentrate a little better. Yet to be exposed triggers to test if it will stop panic attacks.If you are prescribed this medication don't be scared. Especially if you've made personal progress by doing therapy or just improving your general mindset but are still struggling. Wish I'd started it years ago.

I held off on the medication for a very long time, even after being diagnosed with anxiety and depression at the age of 12. I am now 24, and after countless attempts of therapy sessions and coming to the realisation that it is indeed genetic, I’m here. My doc prescribed me 5mg but suggested I start on 2.5mg. I did so for four days, and began to feel really good. I’m talking, like, really good. Besides the drowsiness, I felt focused. My anxiety was subtle. I ended up having a lot of energy. I then started taking 5mg, and all those good feelings have now diminished. I’m feeling dizzy, nauseous, anxious, heart race, loss of appetite, tired. To be honest, I feel a little depressed.
